Sign in

What is the "Wall" tab?

The "Wall" tab is the one that is selected by default in the App menu upon opening, once the connection has been established to your account..

What can I see on the Wall?

You will be able to see (in reverse chronological order - from newest to oldest):

  • at the top of the page, the 5 communications selected to appear in the communication banner
  • new communications whatever the type (article, video, link to a training course, ...)
  • duel notifications

What is the "Catalog" tab?

The "Catalog" tab is the second in the App menu.

You can see all the training courses to which the learner has access.

My current training courses

At the top of the page are the current training courses of the learner, the training courses started by the learner, but not completed.

My training courses accessible from categories

Under the current courses are listed the different categories in which are the training courses to which the learner has access.

How to add a training course by code?

The learner can also download a training course for which he has received a code to install it via thebutton at the top right of the screen.

Read the article «How to give access to a training course with a code?»

The learner is not enrolled to any training course

If the learner is not enrolled to any training course, he will have the opportunity to request to download open access training by clicking on Pick one for me:

What is the "Search" tab?

The "Search" tab is the third in the App menu.

Do you have access to many training courses but don't have the patience to go through them all when you want to find one in particular?

Search

Thanks to the Search function, you can search for training courses by a keyword. The training courses suggested will be those whose keyword is contained in the name of the category, the title, the code or the description of the training course, but also in the content of article-type communications

Do not hesitate to use the See more button if it is displayed in order to see more items found during the search.

What is the "Profile" tab?

The "Profile" tab is the fourth in the App menu.

You can access to your learner profile through this tab.

Key indicators

This screen shows several statistics:

  • Total time: the time spent in the app performing activities or reading articles
  • Completed training courses: the number of training courses completed
  • Points: the number of points acquired by completing activities

Badges

Displays the badges won (in red) and to be won (in gray).

Do not hesitate to click on a training course to access it again, or download it if it has been deleted from your mobile device in the meantime.

Profile information modification

Clicking on theicon to the right of your name will open the form. You will then be able to modify your information and password if necessary.

Finish this action by clicking on Register to save your changes or on the cross at the top right to close the form without making any changes to your profile information.

App parameters modification and logout

Clicking on theicon at the top right of the screen, will enable you to access the App parameters. Also, you will be able to logout if needed.

  • enable or disable push notifications
  • change the time for training reminders
  • change the language of the App
  • enable or disable usage statistics
  • get help and access the Help Center
  • see the contact page (see below)
  • see the version of the App installed on your mobile device
  • logout

Click the icon again to exit the screen and return to the main profile screen.

The contact page

Accessing the contact page will enable you to:

  • see information about the publisher
  • see the version of the App installed on your mobile device
  • access the Contact button allowing you to send an email directly to those responsible for the application
  • access the Feedback button to evaluate and rate the App

What is the "Add-ons" tab?

The "Add-ons" tab is the last in the App menu.

What can I see on this screen?

The Add-ons screen opens the doors to your training ecosystem: a chatbot, a product catalog, a comparator, a discussion forum, links to social networks, a mini-website, the QR code reader or any other useful resource.

Help Center Glossary

Enrolled / unenrolled (active / inactive): learner account status defined in the profile in the Mission Center. There are two possibilities for a learner account to go into inactive status: the learner has not been connected during a defined period or its status is modified by a manager. When a learner account is inactive, the learner can no longer log in.

App: the App or application is the Teach on Mars tool installed in a mobile device

Learners: people with an account accessing the App or the Webapp allowing them to complete training courses, receive communications, ...

Badges: rewardin the form of a badge allocated according to the result of a learner on an activity (success, flawless) or training course (total completion)

Catalog: set of training courses arranged in categories and appearing for a learner in his/her training tab.

Category: grouping of several training courses appearing in the catalog

Custom field: additional field to the default fields for grouping learners and thus use filters to provide access to training courses, send communications and analyze statistics

Certification: rewarddelivered in the form of a certificate by email to the learner for having successfully completed the scoring activities of a certifying module of a training course

Completion: term used when an activity, module or training course has been fully completed

In training: indicates that the learner has started at least one training course

Training course: it is the course to be carried out, composed of modules, themselves composed ofactivities

Direct link to a training course or an activity: this link is requested by the Teach on Mars support team in order to be able to analyze and come to assistance more quickly. This is the direct link leading to the training course or to a training activity in the Mission Center

Live!: mobile activity that is played face-to-face and in real time. The Live! is a paid option, which can be activated on demand

Managers: people with an account accessing the Mission Center allowing them to perform several actions (translations, creation of training courses, creation of learner accounts, creation of communications, etc.)

Mission Center: administration platform allowing managers to perform several actions (translations, creation of training courses, creation of learner accounts, creation of communications, etc.)

OTS: or on-the-shelf contents, duplication of training courses from a supplier Mission Center to the client Mission Center

Points:rewarddelivered in the form of points. All the activities earn points counted in the learner statistics (by activity or by training course), with the exception of Toolbox, Self-evaluation and exercises

Progress: percentage showing the progress in terms of the activities carried out / started / completed by the learner within a training course

Score:learner's result in an assessment activity, reduced to 100%. This score will be compared to the pass threshold set for the activity to determine whether it was successful or not

Success: term used when an activity has been successful based on the success threshold defined in the activity configuration

Test version: status of a training course allowing the Manager to review and validate the training course before publishing it and thus making it accessible to learners registered for the training course. The status of content reviewer is necessary to have access to the training in Test version.

Webapp:if the learner cannot access the Teach on Mars application from a mobile device, he or she will access the application from a computer (desktop) to the Webapp (Web application)

How to change the Mission Center language or logout?

The Mission Center offers additional options that can be configured outside of the Administrator profile.

How to change the Mission Center language?

You will find several icons at the top right of the Mission Center, regardless of the page used.

Click on to access the drop-down list

Select the language and click on Save.

How to logout from the Mission Center?

You will find several icons at the top right of the Mission Center, regardless of the page used.

Click onto logout from the Mission Center.

How to modify your manager profile?

Vous pouvez modifier votre profil administrateur

How to access your administrator profile?

There are two ways to access its own administrator profile.

1. You will find several icons at the top right of the Mission Center, regardless of the page used.

Click onto directly access your administrator profile

2.

> ADMINISTRATION / Managers

A "Super admin" account will see all administrators account of the Mission Center unlike the "simple" administrator account which will only see its own account and those it has created beforehand.

If the list of administrator accounts is very long, you can use the Login, emailfield to search among the Mission Center administrator accounts.

How to modify my nickname?

On top of the screen, click onto the right of your name to edit your administrator account.

In this window you can modify your nickname and your status (active or inactive)

Then click on Change name to save your changes.

How to modify my password?

Click onChange password


Enter your new password in the two text fields and click Confirm to save your change.

How to modify the learner account linked to my administrator account (add-on manager)?

Click onto the right of Linked learner

Find and select your learner and click Apply to save your change.

Click on if you want to remove the link with the learner and no longer link the administrator account to a learner account

Read the articles What is the add-on manager?"if you do not know this option accessible from the App, or "How does the add-on manager work?" ifyou have already enabled the option but have not yet linked a learner account and wish to learn how to do so.

How to modify my image?

Mouse over the image and you will see:

  • an image icon to access the new window that will allow you to browse your files
  • a “pencil” icon to edit the current image in order to zoom in / out
  • a download icon to save the current image on your computer

How to modify my rights?

Read the article "What are the manager's rights?" to get more information about it.

What are the general statistics of the App?

The management interface of the Teach on Mars solution allows you to collect several statistics:

  • General App statistics
  • Les General statistics on all training courses
  • Les Detailed statistics by training course
  • Les Detailed statistics by learner

Overview of key indicators

> HOME/ Key indicators

On the Mission Center home page, you can see the general statistics of the App (all training courses and all learners combined according to the rights given to your Administrator account).

  • Thepenetration rate
  • Thekey figures
  • The penetration rate history
  • Enrolled learners behaviour

The details of these different statistics are included below in the article.

How to get a detailed view of key indicators by main category?

Click on Select a main category:

and choose the main category for which you want to see the key indicators

How to obtain a detailed view of the key indicators by filter (custom field)?

Click on Filters:

and complete the information in the different custom fields

Finish by clicking on Apply.

Note: If you have made a mistake in one of the custom fields, click on Reset to clear the data and start again from the beginning.

How to obtain the key indicators over a defined period?

You can select a period for which you want to obtain the key indicators.

Note: This option will only update the Penetration rate history and the Behavior of registered learners.

Click on the calendar

You have different options:

  • Last 30 days
  • Last 3 months
  • Last 12 months
  • Custom: use calendar to set start date and end date

Click onApplyto confirm your choice.

Key indicators in details

1. Penetration rate:

  • the total number of enrolled learners in the Mission Center (active learners only)
  • the number of learners who started at least one training course (active learners only)
  • the number of learners who have completed at least one training course (completed) (active learners only)

2. General statistics of the App :

  • the number of learners having access to at least one training course (learners in a training course) (active and inactive learners).

Note: This amount may be different from the amount of completed training course if a training course has been deleted or if a learner's access has been modified / deleted.

  • the total number of training course days (hours of training) (accumulated by all learners)
  • average training course time per learner (hours / learner) (in minutes)
  • the number of licenses used since the anniversary date (trained learner)

3. Penetration rate history:

  • the total number of enrolled learners in the Mission Center
  • the number of learners who started at least one training course
  • the number of learners who have completed at least one training course

Note: this data varies depending on the period defined in the calendar.

This graph can be seen in numbers

But it can also be seen in percentages

4. Enrolled learners behaviour:

  • New learners: the number of learners who connect for the first time
  • Returned learners: the number of learners who log in when they have already logged in at least once

Note:these date vary according to the period defined in the calendar.

This graph can be seen in numbers

But it can also be seen in percentages

How to export key indicators in Excel® format?

Click on Export to view these key indicators in an Excel® report.

and select

  • the report language(language) du rapport
  • the export by activity or by training course

How to correctly display an export file containing special characters?

It may happen that when opening your export file, all the data is in one line, or that special characters are not correctly displayed.

The problem is that the file opens without using UTF-8 encoding, so the content is badly interpreted.

How to modify the file?

If you do not find how to set Excel® to force it to open in UTF-8, the easiest way is:

1) Open the csv file with a simple text editor (Notepad, TextEdit, Text Wrangler, Sublime Text ...), you can now check if the characters are correctly displayed

2) Open a new Excel® document
3) Copy/Paste all the csv file content opened in your text editor in the first cell (A1) of the Excel® document.

How to convert my file?

1) Select the first column A (in which is all the content that has been pasted)
2) ClickData/Convert
3) A popup opens, clickNextthen Choose the separator "semicolon" in the 2nd window, thenEnd
4) Everything is correctly tabulated, and the good characters have been preserved.

What is the statistics export in csv?

1. Statistics: Excel® export

  1. The management interface providesdetailed analyzes by learner and learning activityduring anExcel export. This report contains the information of all training courses and / or applications managed by this management interface.

    Note:

    • The "Export" functionalityignores the filters activatedand exports all the available information
    • It exports the same information from the different analytics menusKey indicatorsandTraining courses reports.
    • Pre-formatted filtersin the Excel sheet allow users selecting the relevant information.
    • The information is in real time. This is an inventory of the data present in the management interface at the time of export.

    The Excel report provides the following data:

    NB: "Login" is the only mandatory learner filter. Other columns depend on learners' filter set up by the manager/trainer.

    1. Training course/Application: Training course or application managed in the management interface
    2. Login: The learner login ID
    3. Learner account fields: email, first name, last name... Filtersused by trainers/managers unless archived
    4. Status: Active (learner can log in to the app) vs inactive (learner is created but has no (more) access to the application)
    5. Activity: Activity name
    6. Time spent: Cumulated time spent on the activity or a category
    7. Progress: Advancement percentage of the activity or category completion
    8. Score:Percentage of correctly answered questions. For scored activities only (for more information, read the article "What is a scored activity? "
    9. Success: Boolean (0/1) indicating if thesuccess threshold is reached.Only for scored activities
    10. Points: Point gained by the learner, either by category or by activity (more details about the points rules, read the article "How are learners points calculated?"

2.Data export customization:

It is recommended to access theTraining courses statistics and rankings, Learners statistics and rankings ou The Wall : statistics and rankingssection to know all the details concerning the customization of exports possible according to the different statistics.

How are the statistics handled if the learner's device changes?

The Teach on Mars app can be installed on several devices, with a same learner account.

What happens if the learner changes devices?

At each connection only and on each device, synchronize automatically:

  • progress
  • assiduity
  • time spent
  • badges

The score, level and duels are also synchronized in real time, as soon as the device is online.

In the case of public access (without authentication), each connection to a new device creates a new account (via the creation of a new nickname), so there is no statistics synchronization process.

How to link the statistics with my LMS?

The Teach on Mars application management interface integrates with the main LMS - Learning Management System - via SCORM connectors - Sharable Content Object Reference Model - and Teach on Mars webservices to retrieve data from your different systems.

Which statistics are updated upon the learner log in?

When integrating the Teach on Mars solution into your LMS with the SCORM connector, the following individual statistics are updated each time learners connect to your LMS:

  • Overall progress
  • Success
  • Time spent

How to link your App with Google Analytics?

Teach on Mars installs apluginin its iOS, Android and Webapplicationsto allowtracking by Google Analytics.

Google Analytics allows you to evaluate the performance of your mobile websites and apps.

What data can I obtain via Google Analytics?

Google also provides detailed data that allows you to create more powerful Web, Android, and iOS experiences and applications by evaluating statistics at all levels:

  • User acquisition
  • User interaction
  • Results obtained

This platform also offers quality features such as real-time analysis, advanced segmentation, and the ability to track your own custom and statistical variables.

What reports can I get via Google Analytics?

Google Analytics finally allows you to create:

  • Login Reports: Find out how often your mobile apps are open for the first time.
  • Learner reports: How many learners launch your application every day, on which devices is your application used? What is the geographical distribution of learners?
  • Interaction reports: How do learners interact with your application? How do they navigate in your application? How often and how long do they connect?

Useful information

The following link gives you all the information about the statistics of the Google Analytics tool:

https://www.google.com/intl/en_uk/analytics/

How do languages work in the App?

The Teach on Mars solution is available in almost every language. All applications (interface and content) are offered in multilingual and there is no limit of integrated languages.

How to build your multilingual application?

Teach on Mars provides Excel®activity templates for writing your content. But depending on your version of the Mission Center, you can also use the web authoring tool.

Use of the Webauthoring tool

If you use the Webauthoring tool, you can directly include the translations from the authoring window.

Do not hesitate to read the article "How to manage the training courses content translations?"

Use of Excel® activity templates

Duplicate and fill in your Excel activity templates for each additional language you want. Teach on Mars manages the translation of the interface.

Do not hesitate to read the article "How to manage the training courses content translations?"

How to use your multilingual App?

An option always allows the learners to change the language, for the interface and for each training course (during its download, but also after).

The application detects the language of the learner with the following rules:

1) Theapplicationanalyses the device language. It compares the device language to the ToM Enterprise interface available languages. A default language is always defined. There are 2 options:

  • The device language is defined in the application available languages. In that case, the application selects the device language for its interface.
  • The device language is not defined in the application available languages. In that case, the behavior depends on the application format: the application selects its defined interface default language, for its interface.

2) The training language may differ from the interface language. When learners download a new training, the application checks the active interface language. There are 2 options:

  • The active interface language is defined in the training available languages. In that case, the interface language is proposed
  • The active interface language is notdefined in the training available languages. In that case, the training default language is proposed.

Note:

1. The learner can choose his/her default language (interface language) from the login page

2. The learner can modify his/her language from the profile tab

What happens to languages that read from right to left (RTL or "Right-to-left" languages)?

As from version 18.1, the Teach on Mars solution manages training course content in languages that read from right to left (such as Arabic or Hebrew).

Note: This applies to content only. The app's interface remains in its original language (languages read from left to right only). The RTL language will not work if it is preceded by a latin character.

Can you access a training offline?

The learner can access an offline training course, since he has downloaded the training course beforehand, it is accessible everywhere.

Training courses are downloaded in local mode except for videos, which are by default viewable in streaming (for more information, read the article "How to manage videos in training course activities?").

What is the difference between the online and the offline mode?

When downloading a training course, the learner chooses either theonline mode(default option) or theoffline mode. This option only applies to videos.

  • If the training is downloaded in online mode, it will be accessible offline except forthe videos and training courses updates.
  • If the training is downloaded in offline mode, it will be accessible offlinewithvideosexcept fortraining courses updates.

Where can the user find help?

The learner has two possibilities to find help.

1. Access the Teach on Mars Help Center

From the Profile tab, the learner can click on Help and will be redirected to theTeach on Mars HelpCenter. This option must be requested during the project phase to you Teach on Mars project manager.

2. Add a "support" contact email:

From the Profile tab, theContact / About button(or else following the customer's choice) allows the learner to access the publisher contact page, to click on theContactbutton(or else) to be able to directly send an email to Support to ask questions or obtain additional help.

This support contact address is also to be defined during the project phase and to provide to your Teach on Mars project manager.

How can a learner customize his profile?

From the Profile tabof the App, the learner can modify:

  • his/her avatar
  • his/her first name / last name

How the change the avatar?

Click on the avatar and authorize the App to access your pictures. Then select a picture in your Gallery or else, or directly take a new picture.

How to change the first and last name?

Clicking on the icon to the right of your name, the form appears and you can then modify your information.

Finish this action by clicking on Register to save your modifications or on the top right cross to close the form without saving the changes to your profile.

What is the "Opt Out Google Analytics" functionality?

This feature enables learners to block the retrieval of anonymous data when using the mobile learning application.

Note:This is an optional feature.

How to activate or deactivate the "Opt Out Google Analytics" feature in your app?

  • In your user profile, select "My account".
  • In "Miscellaneous", you can activate or deactivate the "Anonymous analytics"option.

From the Profile tab, click on, you can then choose to activate or not the Usage Analytics

Note: To learn more about Google’s statistical data, read the article "Comment lier l'App et Google Analytics ?"

What's the Shake'n'learn functionality?

Shake'n'Learn brings up a pop-up window that lets the learner launch an activity as soon as he shakes his phone from the App homepage.

This feature is enabled whenever the learner completes an activity for the first time.

This feature is based on a prescribing algorithm that provides learners with activities that they have failed or failed to do recently, in order to respect and optimize the established learning path.

Conditions for Shake'n'Learn to work:

1. For mobile devices:

  • Android : you need to be on any screen except inside an activity
  • iOS : you need to be on the Catalog or Profile page

2. The training must be synchronized on the mobile device. In other words, if the training course has been started on another device A and not yet downloaded to a device B, it will not work. Once the training course downloaded on the device B and consequently synchronized, the feature will be taken into account.

Note: The feature will only offer scored activities already done:

  • Challenge
  • Fill the Gap
  • Pick a Word
  • Sushi Game
  • Training Game
  • Wordspool
  • Quiz Game

Note: Shake'n'Learn is only available from 17.4 version of the application. Shake'n'learn is not available in Live! mode

How to assign a training course to several categories?

How can I assign my training to several categories?

> CATALOG/ Training courses
  • Select the training course you would like to see in two categories
> CATALOG/ Training courses> Manage> Administration
  • In theDetailssection, click onto open the editing window
  • Click onAdd secondary category
  • Select the category name from the drop-down list
  • Finish by clicking on Save to save your action

Two category names now appear in the Details section:

How to add, delete and edit categories within the training course catalog?

Training courses are organized into categories in a training course catalog. The Teach on Mars solution allows up to 3 levels of hierarchy per category.

You define the categories and their order in the Mission Center.

Note :Training courses appear in alphanumeric order in thecategories

Category creation

> CATALOG/ Categories

The already existing categories appear as a list. Click onCreate, give a name to your new Category in the Name field and finish by clicking Save.

Note: Inside categories, training courses are alphabetically listed.

Rename (and translate) a category name

> CATALOG/ Categories

Select the category you wish to rename or translate and click onto edit it.

You can see all the accessible languages ​​of the Mission Center. Change the default language for your category or provide a translation for another language. Finish by clicking on Save.

Note: If your main language is not English and you do not insert any translation, the name you have given to your Category will be used under In English by default.

Delete a category

> CATALOG/ Categories

Select the category you want to delete and click onto delete it. Finish by clicking on Confirm to confirm the deletion of the category, or on Cancel to cancel the request.

How to handle categories translation?

Translate a category name

> CATALOG/ Categories

Select the category you wish to translate and click on to edit it.

You can see all the accessible languages ​​of the Mission Center (as well as their code in brackets).

Add translations for other languages. Finish by clicking on Save.

Notes:

  • If your main language is not English and you do not insert any translation, the name you have given to your Category will be listed under In English by default.
  • For your category name to fully appear, it is recommended not to exceed 12 characters

How to add an image to categories?

How to add an image to my category?

> CATALOG/ Categories

Select the category for which you want to add an image. Click on the image insert on the right. In the new window, choose your image and confirm your choice.

You will be able to:

  • zoom in or out the image
  • move the image in the window to focus on part of the image. Finish by clicking on Save to save your modification or on Cancel to cancel the action in progress.

Your image appears in the insert on the right of your training.

How to modify my category image?

On mouse over on the image, three icons appear:

: this icon allows you to modify the image. By clicking on it, the window opens and allows you to browse your files on the computer and thus select a new image. Finish by confirming your choice.

: this icon allows you to edit the current image. By clicking on it, it is again possible to zoom in / out the image, or to focus on a part of the image. Finish by clicking on Save to save your modification or on Cancel to cancel the action in progress.

: this icon allows the download of the current image. By clicking on it, the window opens and allows you to give a name to the image. Finish by confirming your Saving.

Why a category does not appear in the App?

I just created a category and it is not visible in the App, why?

It is possible that certain categories may not be visible in your learners App; there may be two reasons:

1.There is no training course in the category: when a category is created but does not contain any training (yet), this category is not displayed in the App. The category can be visible only after you integrated training course(s) into it.

2.The learner is enrolled in no training course of the category: when a learner has no access to any training course from acategory, this category is not displayed in the App. A category can be visible, only if the learner has access to at least one training course.

Brainstorming

Note:Brainstorming is an activity to be played during a Live! session.

What is the Brainstorming activity?

In the classroom, Brainstorming allows you to probe your audience from the questions you provide in this Activity Template. Each participant can send their answers and "likes" the answers of the other participants. At the end of the activity, a ranking of the answers is proposed, calculated according to the number of "likes".

Academic purpose

Brainstorming is part of theEngagephase of the ELPA learning cycle, with Live!

Suitable forBadge, Score, Shake'n'Learn features:no

Live!:yes

Available medias:no

Web app compatible:yes

Features

  • Timing
  • Questions
  • Excel® activity templates allowing the author to prepare his/her questions (or the Webauthoring tool)

Customizable items

  • Introduction card title
  • Introduction card text
  • Game time (by the trainer)

Module type in the Mission Center:training path

Upgradeshistory:only available from 18.1 version

How to use the Webauthoring tool for the Brainstorming activity?

> CATALOG / Training courses> Your training course > Authoring

To find out more about creating an activity, read the article "How to create the training course content for the first time?"

Edit your Brainstorming activity.

The Webauthoring tool for the Brainstorming activity ismade up of two tabs:

  1. Content
  2. Parameters

How to fill in the Excel® Brainstorming activity template?

All activities can be downloaded from:

> CATALOG/ Training courses> Manage

by clicking at the top right of the screen on Activity templates.

They can also be downloaded from the training course authoring page.

Note: it is recommended to download the activity templates regularly, or even each time you use them, as these are frequently updated

The Excel® activity template for the Brainstorming activity is made up of three tabs:

  • Instructions
  • Configuration
  • Cards

1. The Instructions tab provides access to the Help Center article on the activity in question. It also shows screenshots of the rendering on the App.

2. The Configuration tab shows the different configurations to configure for the activity:

  • Option of the activity. If not changed, the default configuration will be applied

    • D3 cell: the participation method (anonymous or nominative)

  • The introduction of the activity. If the text is not changed, the default text will be displayed.
    • Cellule D5cell: the introductory title (limited to 25 characters)
    • Cellule D6cell: the introductory text (limited to 200 characters)

3. TheCardstab is used to create the questions:

  • ColumnA :question (limited to 150 characters)

What is the rendering of the Brainstorming activity in the App?


Do you need to translate your activity? Do not hesitate to read thearticle on translations management of training courses content.

Challenge

What is the Challenge activity?

STOP-WATCHED QUESTIONNAIRE WITH SUCCESS THRESHOLD

Challenge is a series of single-choice questions. The learner answers questions that follow one another. Challenge is timed. At the end of the activity, the learner succeeds or fails according to his score. When he fails, the application recommends the activity to be revised in order toconsolidate hisknowledge.

Academic purpose

Challenge is presented as a drillingsession during thePracticephase of the ELPA cycle.

Suitable forBadge, Score, Shake'n'Learn features:yes

Live!:yes

Available medias:images (.png/.jpg/.jpeg)

Web app compatible:yes

Features

  • Timer
  • Score, in the form of a progress bar. It turns green for each correct answer and red for each incorrect answer.
  • By question: 1 correct answer, 1 or 2 incorrect answer (s)
  • Question in picture (optional)
  • Questions limited in number of characters
  • Possibility to add corrections at the end (from version 18.1 Ganymede)

Customizable items

  • Introduction card title*
  • Introduction card text
  • Timing
  • Number of questions per game session
  • Number of questions to be answered correctly to validate the activity
  • Order of appearance of questions*
  • Title of conclusion card*
  • Text conclusion card in case of no fault / success / non-success*

Module type:training path

Upgradeshistory:* only available from 17.4 version

How to use the Webauthoring tool for the Challenge activity?

> CATALOG/ Trainingcourses> Your training course > Authoring

To find out more about creating an activity, read the article "How to create the training course content for the first time?"

Edit your Challenge activity.

The Webauthoring tool for the Challenge activity ismade up of two tabs:

  1. Content
  2. Parameters

1. Content

With the Webauthoring tool, you do not need the activity ID, it can be directly found in a drop-down list

2. Parameters

How to fill in the Excel® Challenge activity template?

All activities can be downloaded from:

> CATALOG/ Training courses> Manage

by clicking at the top right of the screen on Activity templates.

They can also be downloaded from the training course authoring page.

Note: it is recommended to download the activity templates regularly, or even each time you use them, as these are frequently updated

The Excel® activity template for the Challenge activity is made up of three tabs:

  1. Instructions
  2. Configuration
  3. Cards

1. The Instructions tab provides access to the Help Center article on the activity in question. It also shows screenshots of the rendering on the App.

2. The Configuration tab shows the different configurations to configure for the activity:

  • Challenge configuration (mandatory). If the data are not changed, the default configuration will be applied
    • D3 cell: the number of questions to display (ex : you create 30 questions and wish to display 12 of them)
    • D4 cell: the number of correct answers to successfully complete the activity (ex : you display 12 questions and the learner must correctly answer 8 of them)
    • D5 cell:the time allowed to complete the activity (in seconds)
    • D6 cell: display or not the correction (and explanations)
    • D7 cell:the order of appearance of the questions (ordered: identical to the order of creation, random: mixed or mixed: at the first launch of the activity the order is identical, with the launches that follow, the order is mixed)
  • Activity introduction. If the text is not changed, the default text will be displayed.
    • D9cell:the introduction title (limited to 50 characters)
    • D10 cell:the introduction text (limited to 200characters)
  • Activity conclusion.If the text is not changed, the default text will be displayed.
    • D12 cell:the conclusion card title (limited to 25 characters)
    • D13 cell: the text to display in the event of flawless success (limited to 100 characters)
    • D14 cell: the text to display in case of success with fault at the completion of the activity (limited to 100 characters)
    • D15 cell: the text to display in case of failure to complete (limited to 100 characters)

3. TheCardstab allows to create questions:

  • ColumnA : ID link to the activity

    • ColumnB :the question (limited to 150 characters)
    • Column E :specificmediacolumn if you wish to add an image(as a reminder, in the specific media columns, it is not necessary to use the media tags [media: myimage.jpg], you just need to inform the name and extension of the image myimage.jpg)
    • ColumnF :answer 1 (correct answer, limited to 50 characters)
    • ColumnI : answer 2 (incorrectanswer, limited to 50 characters)
    • ColumnL : answer 3 (incorrectanswer, limited to 50 characters)
    • ColumnO : the correction (limited to 350 characters)

What is the rendering of the Challenge activity in the App?

Do you need to translate your activity? Do not hesitate to read thearticle on translations management of training courses content.

Exercises

What is the Exercises activity?

Real-life situation scenarios

For the things we have to learn before we can do them, we learn by doing themsaid Aristotle, a while ago!

The Exercises activity proposes real-life situation scenarios validating the training principles. The Self-evaluationactivity, combined with the Exercises activity, gives the learner recommended activities. Once prescribed, aI did it todaybutton is added to the exercise card.

Academic purpose

The Exercises activity is proposed during theApplyphase of the ELPA learning cycle in order to putthe learner's acquired knowledge into action.

Suitable forBadge, Score, Shake'n'Learn features:no

Live!:no

Available medias:images (.png/.jpg/.jpeg),audio (.mp3), PDF documents, video (.mp4, integrable subtitles)

Web app compatible:yes

Features

  • Association of each exercisewith a category
  • Unlimited content (with scrolling on some mobiles from 400 characters)
  • Card title limited to 25 characters

Customizable items

  • Unlimited number of exercises per category

Module type:self-evaluation / exercises

Upgradeshistory:

  • 17.4 : non applicable
  • 16.9 : non applicable

Not applicable = nomodification has been made from 16.9 version

Read thearticleto learn more on Self-evaluation / Exercises modules.

How to use the Webauthoring tool for the Exercises activity?

> CATALOG/ Trainingcourses> Your training course > Authoring

To find out more about creating an activity, read the article "How to create the training course content for the first time?"

Edit your Exercises activity.

The Webauthoring tool for theExercises activity is made up of two tabs:

  1. Content 1: linked to the Exercises-type activity
  2. Content 2:linked to the Self-evaluation-type activity

The names of the profiles created on the Content 1 page will be available in the drop-down menu on the Content 2 page.

How to fill in the Excel® Exercises activity template?

All activities can be downloaded from:

> CATALOG/ Training courses> Manage

by clicking at the top right of the screen on Activity templates.

They can also be downloaded from the training course authoring page.

Note: it is recommended to download the activity templates regularly, or even each time you use them, as these are frequently updated

The Excel® activity template for the Exercises activity is made up of three tabs:

  1. Instructions
  2. Configuration
  3. Cards

1. The Instructions tab provides access to the Help Center article on the activity in question. It also shows screenshots of the rendering on the App.

2. The Configuration tab shows the different configurations to configure for the activity:

  • ColumnD : the category name. Please note that the category must correspond to a Self-evaluation activity profile linked to this activity.

3. TheCardstab allows to create content:

  • ColumnA: link to the associated category (and predefined in the Configuration tab)
  • ColumnC :the title (limited to 25 characters)
  • ColumnF :the content (limited to 400 characters)

What is the rendering of the Exercises activity in the App?

Do you need to translate your activity? Do not hesitate to read thearticle on translations management of training courses content.

Fill the Gap

What is the Fill the Gap activity?

Timed fill-in-the-blank text completion

With Fill the Gap, the learner completes a series of sentences with their missing word. For each sentence, three annotated rocketsrun through the screen from bottom to top. The learner selects the rocket with the correct word. He succeeds or not the activity according to the score reached at the end of the given time.

Academic purpose

Fill the Gap is designed to validate what has been learned. It is proposed in thePracticephase of the ELPA cycle, to evaluate and consolidate knowledge.

Suitable forBadge, Score, Shake'n'Learn features:yes

Live!:yes

Available medias:no media

Web app compatible:yes

Features

  • Timer
  • Score, in the form of a progress bar. It turns green for each correct answer and red for each incorrect answer.
  • Per sentence: 1 correct answer, 2 incorrect answers
  • Sentences limited to 100 characters, answers limited to 13 characters

Customizable items

  • Introduction card title*
  • Introduction card text
  • Game duration
  • Number of questions per game session
  • Number of questions to answer correctly to validate the activity (success threshold)
  • Background image (.png / .jpg)
  • Cursors images (.png)*
  • Question sorting method*
  • Conclusion card title*
  • Conclusion card text displayed when faultless/ success / fail*

Module type:training path

Upgradeshistory:only available from 17.4 version

How to use the Webauthoring tool for the Fill the Gap activity?

> CATALOG/ Trainingcourses> Your training course > Authoring

To find out more about creating an activity, read the article "How to create the training course content for the first time?"

Edit your Fill the Gap activity.

The Webauthoring tool for the Fill the Gap activity is made up of three tabs:

  1. Content
  2. Parameters
  3. Graphic design

1. Content

2. Parameters & Graphic Design

How to fill in the Excel® Fill the Gap activity template?

All activities can be downloaded from:

> CATALOG/ Training courses> Manage

by clicking at the top right of the screen on Activity templates.

They can also be downloaded from the training course authoring page.

Note: it is recommended to download the activity templates regularly, or even each time you use them, as these are frequently updated

The Excel® activity template for the Fill the Gap activity is made up of three tabs:

  1. Instructions
  2. Configuration
  3. Cards

1. The Instructions tab provides access to the Help Center article on the activity in question. It also shows screenshots of the rendering on the App.

2. TheConfigurationtab shows the different configurations to configure for the activity:

  • Fill the GapConfiguration (mandatory). If the data are not modified, the standard configuration will be applied
    • D3 cell: the number of questions to display (ex : you create 30 questions and wish to display 12 of them)
    • D4 cell: the number of correct answers to successfully complete the activity (ex : you display 12 questions and the learner must correctly answer 8 of them)
    • D5 cell: the time allowed to complete the activity (in seconds, minimum 30 seconds)
    • D6 cell: the order of appearance of the questions (ordered: identical to the order of creation, random: mixed or mixed: at the first launch of the activity the order is identical, with the launches that follow, the order is mixed)
  • The activity introduction.If the text is not changed, the default text will be displayed.
    • D8 cell: the introduction title (limited to 25 characters)
    • D9 cell:the introduction text (limited to 200 characters)
  • The activity conclusion.If the text is not changed, the default text will be displayed.
    • D11 cell: the conclusion card title (limited to 25 characters)
    • D12 cell: the text to display in the event of flawless success (limited to 100 characters)
    • D13 cell:the text to display in case of success with fault at the completion of the activity (limited to 100 characters)
    • D14 cell:the text to display in case of failure to complete (limited to 100 characters)
  • Graphic configuration of the activity.If the data are not changed, the default configuration will be applied
    • D16 cell: use the default cursor (rocket) or a custom cursor. The image must be in .png and be named cursor.png with a resolution of 124x228px
    • D17 cell: use of the cursor in the event of a default error (parachute) or of a personalized cursor. The image must be in .png and be named falling.png with a resolution of 54x104px
    • D18 cell: use the default background image (sky) or a custom background image. The image must be in .jpg and be named background.jpg with a resolution of 768x1024px

3. TheCardstab allows to create questions:

  • ColumnA :the question (limited to 100 characters). In your question, replace the word to be found by *** (three stars), ex : There are *** months in a year (proposals : 12, 24, 60)
  • ColumnD :answer 1 (correctanswer, limited to 13 characters)
  • ColumnG :answer2 (incorrectanswer, limited to 13 characters)
  • ColumnJ:answer3 (incorrectanswer, limited to 13 characters)

What is the rendering of the Fill the Gap activity in the App?

Do you need to translate your activity? Do not hesitate to read thearticle on translations management of training courses content.

Flash course

The Flash Course activity is no longer available as from version 19.6("Callisto"). The "flash cards" can be used in the Mobile Course activity.

What is the Flash Course activity?

Anchoring of knowledge by association or open question

The Flash Course offersthe learner to work on hisassociative memory by providing himwith information on a double-sided card.

What is the pedagogical advantage of this activity? Well, you can display two levels of information: you invite the learner to first think and make an assumption before returning the cardto discover more information, an answer...

Academic purpose

The Flash Course is designed to provide knowledge and is displayedupstream of the ELPA learning cycle in theLearnstage. It is however multi-purpose andcanalso be part of thePracticephase of the ELPA cycle.

Suitable forBadge, Score, Shake'n'Learn features:no

Live!:no

Available medias:images (.png/.jpg/.jpeg),audio (.mp3), PDF document, video (.mp4, integrable subtitling)

Web app compatible :yes

Features

  • Two-sided information cards: unlimited content (with scrolling on some mobiles from 350 characters)
  • Card titles limited to 25-characters
  • Buttons text limited to 20 characters

Customizable items

  • Introduction card title*
  • Introduction card text
  • Conclusion card title*
  • Conclusion card text
  • One-sided and two-sided display buttons

Module type:training path

Upgradeshistory

  • only available from 17.4 version
  • this activity is no more available as from version 19.6

How to use the Webauthoring tool for the Flash course activity?

> CATALOG/ Trainingcourses> Your training course > Authoring

To find out more about creating an activity, read the article "How to create the training course content for the first time?"

Note: The Flash Course activity is no more used on its own, it is included in theMobile Courseactivity as a card-type.

How to fill in the Excel® Flash course activity template?

All activities can be downloaded from:

> CATALOG/ Training courses> Manage

by clicking at the top right of the screen on Activity templates.

They can also be downloaded from the training course authoring page.

Note: it is recommended to download the activity templates regularly, or even each time you use them, as these are frequently updated

Note: The Flash Course activity is no more used on its own, it is included in theMobile Courseactivity as a card-type.

What is the rendering of the Flash course activity in the App?

Do you need to translate your activity? Do not hesitate to read thearticle on translations management of training courses content.

Flash Game

What is the Flash Game activity?

Revision and repetition game

Do you remember the memo cards of your childhood? Stay a big child: continue to train and improve your associative memory with the Flash Game activity. Flash Game offers the learner two-sided cards; they appear fromthe top of the screen. The front of the card presents the question and the reverse side, the answer. The learner has three options:

  • He knows the answer: he slips the card to the right
  • He doesn't know the answer: he slides the cardto the left
  • He is curious and wishes to check the answer: he turns the card and discovers the solution on the back before slipping it on one side or the other

Once all the cards have been swiped to the right (the learner thus indicating that all the knowledge in the activity has been assimilated), the progress bar reaches 100% and the activity restarts to allow the learner to revise again. He can decide to exit the activity at any time by clicking on the back arrow at the top left.

Academic purpose

Flash Game is designed to anchor knowledge and therefore advised in thePracticephase of the ELPA cycle.

Suitable forBadge, Score, Shake'n'Learn features:no

Live!:no

Available medias:images (.png/.jpg/.jpeg)

Web app compatible:yes

Features

  • Two-sided information cards: texts limited to 350 characters
  • A customizable tutorial is shown at the first launch of the game, so the learner can understand how the activity works (this tutorial only appears once)
  • Cards are presented until the learner stops the game
  • Each correct answer increases the learner's progress rate. To reach 100%, the learner must master all the cards
  • Cardsare dynamically proposed according to the success of the learner and their frequency of display
  • Buttons text limited to 20 characters

Customizable items

  • Introduction card text
  • Conclusion card text
  • Text displayed in a special cardwhen the learner reaches 100%.
  • Background image (.png/.jpg) of the screen (and not only one card)

Module type:training path

Upgrade history:

  • 17.4 : not applicable
  • 16.9 : not applicable

Not applicable = nomodification has been made from 16.9 version

How to use the Webauthoring tool for the Flash Game activity?

> CATALOG/ Trainingcourses> Your training course > Authoring

To find out more about creating an activity, read the article "How to create the training course content for the first time?"

Edit your Flash Game activity.

The Webauthoring tool for theFlash Game activity is made up of two tabs:

  1. Content
  2. Graphic design

How to fill in the Excel® Flash Game activity template?

All activities can be downloaded from:

> CATALOG/ Training courses> Manage

by clicking at the top right of the screen on Activity templates.

They can also be downloaded from the training course authoring page.

Note: it is recommended to download the activity templates regularly, or even each time you use them, as these are frequently updated

The Excel® activity template for the Fill the Gap activity is made up of three tabs:

  1. Instructions
  2. Configuration
  3. Cards

1. The Instructions tab provides access to the Help Center article on the activity in question. It also shows screenshots of the rendering on the App.

2. TheConfigurationtab shows the different configurations to configure for the activity:

  • Flash Game Introduction (optional cards).If they are not modified, the text by default will be displayed.
    • D3cell: the front of the introductory text 1, limited to 400 characters (optional card). It is possible to add an image to it.
    • D4cell: the back of the introductory text 1, limited to 400 characters (card mandatory if the front is used). It is possible to add an image to it.
    • D5 cell: the front of the introductory text 2, limited to 400 characters (optional card). It is possible to add an image to it.
    • D6 cell: the back of the introductory text 2, limited to 400 characters (card mandatory if the front is used). It is possible to add an image to it.
  • Flash Game Web Introduction (optional cards for the Webapp). If they are not completed, the introduction cards (above) will be displayed in the Webapp.
    • 8D cell: the front of introduction text 1 (front), limited to 400 characters (optional card). It is possible to add an image to it.
    • 9D cell: the back of the introductory text 1 (back), limited to 400 characters (card mandatory if the front is used). It is possible to add an image to it.
    • 10D cell: the front of the introductory text 2 (front), limited to 400 characters (optional card). It is possible to add an image to it.
    • 11D cell: the back of the introductory text 2 (back), limited to 400 characters (card mandatory if the front is used). It is possible to add an image to it.
  • Flash Game Conclusion (optional cards).If they are not modified, the text by default will be displayed.
    • 13Dcell: the conclusion text, limited to 400 characters. It is notpossible to add an image to it.
  • Graphic configuration of the activity. If the data are not modified, the configuration by default will be applied (white background).
    • 15D cell:choice of background image used for Flash Game cards. The image must be in .jpg and be named background.jpg with a resolution of 768x1024px

3. TheCardstab allows to create cards content:

  • ColumnA : front content, limited to 350 characters. It is not possible to use an elevator for Flash Game cards
  • ColumnD :back content, limited to 350 characters.It is not possible to use an elevator for Flash Game cards

What is the rendering of the Flash Game activity in the App?

Do you need to translate your activity? Do not hesitate to read thearticle on translations management of training courses content.

How to organize your training course using the Training Structure

The breakdown of the educational content being particularly disrupted by the Mobile Learning and by the Teach on Mars solution, it is needed to think about the training course structure before the design phase.

So even if you are tempted to jump straight into the Mission Center, we recommend that you use the Training Structure.

The interest of the Training Structure

The Training Structure allows you to have a macro view of your training course, while taking into account the specificities of the Teach on Mars solution.

It thus makes it possible to rebalance the different modules and the different types of activity upstream. It also allows you to prepare the training content calmly (visuals, questions and answers) and to plan the various elements you will need.

Finally, it facilitates the communication with your various collaborators of the project: the agency or the freelancer can offer you a structure for validation before starting the design. After the design, it is sent for translation at the same time as the activities in order to adapt all the titles of your training course

What will you need to create your training course?

To design training in the best conditions, we advise you to plan various elements upstream: training course titles, modules and activities, description and keywords, the different types of activities.

The Training Structure allows you to consolidate these elements into a single document.

How does the Training Structure work?

It is an Excel document that cannot be integrated into the Mission Center. It is made up of three tabs to be completed in order. It has a validation system for the number of characters, which will allow you to enter titles that respect the limitations.

Training course tab:

Training course type: 3 proposals in a drop-down menu

  • 100% digital
  • Blended

The Blended Learning is a type of blended learning combining a synchronous part and elements of online training.

  • Face-to-face training

The face-to-face training takes place in a physical classroom.

Target audience: free cell in which you identify the target audience, indicate here the related metadata

Ex: For French commercials → Country: France, Profession: sale

Assessment method(s): Free cell to formalize the assessment protocol you want to set up (Survey to measure satisfaction, Quiz to measure the anchoring of information, etc.)

Badges? Ranking? Certificate? : 2 proposals « yes / no »

Training course objectives, Context / issues, key ideas to remember: free cell where you clarify the context in which the training course will be deployed as well as the need to which the training course meets.

Keywords: insert all the keywords from your training course, separating the ideas with a comma. You can then inform them about the Mission Center with a simple copy and paste: they will allow your training course to be brought up in the search tab.

Training course duration: you see that the duration is grayed out. Indeed, this data will be automatically filled in when the training course tab is completed.

Modules tab

  • Commencez par remplir le titre de module en respectant les limitations de caractère. Automatiquement, le numéro de module s’affiche.
  • Pour le type de module, trois choix s’offrent à vous dans le menu déroulant : pour la plupart des activités vous choisirez « Parcours de formation ». Si vous souhaitez utiliser une activité de type Toolbox ou Self-Evaluation / Exercises, c’est dans cet onglet qu’il faut le renseigner.
  • Les Objectifs du module sont un champ libre dans lequel vous pouvez expliquer les éléments que vous souhaitez retrouver dans votre formation.
  • Start by filling in the module title, respecting the character limitations. Automatically, the module number is displayed.
  • For the type of module, three choices are available to you in the drop-down menu: for most activities you will choose "Training course". If you want to use a Toolbox or Self-Evaluation / Exercises activity type, this is the tab you need to fill in.
  • The Objectives of the module are a free field in which you can explain the elements that you want to find in your training course.

Activities tab

The modules column will allowyou to retrieve the information filled in in the previous tab. Select the module that interests you.

Choose the type of activity you want to insert. Indicate your activity title while respecting the character limitations.

You can then insert the activity objectives, as you did with the module.

The duration of the activity must be indicated in minutes: indicate 1,5 for 1mn30.

Si vous retournez sur le premier onglet, la durée de formation s’est adaptée et vous avez désormais une idée de la durée totale de la formation.

Vous avez rempli votre Training Structure, n’hésitez pas à faire une analyse de votre structure et à appliquer des modifications si celle-ci est déséquilibrée.

Télécharger la Training Structure

If you go back to the first tab, the training course duration has been adapted and you now have an idea of ​​the total duration of the training course.

You have completed your Training Structure, do not hesitate to analyze your structure and apply changes if it is unbalanced.

Download the Training Structure

  • ToM_Academy_TrainingStructure_V2020-FR.xlsx
    30 KB Download
  • ToM_Academy_TrainingStructure_V2020-EN.xlsx
    30 KB Download

How to create a regular training course?

To create a regulartraining course, you have two options:

  • creation from A to Z
  • creation by duplicating an existing regulartraining course

1. CREATE A REGULARTRAINING COURSE FROM A TO Z

> CATALOGUE(Catalog) / Formations(Training courses)

Fill-in the following fields:

  • Name(name of the coaching training)
  • Reference code(unique information linked to the coaching training)
  • Select your category: indicate in which category you would like to create your coaching training
  • Defaultlanguage: allows you to define a standard language for your coaching training
  • Manage the learners' training access: if you wish to give access to all learners without having to create access rules after (this option can be modified later)

Once the training course created, the manager accesses up to 4 sections on hisAdministrationpage:

  1. Details
  2. Learner access management
  3. Modules access management
  4. Image

1. TheDetails sectioncontainsinformation previously completed (training course name, reference code, language by default, keywords, category, ranking enabling, badges enabling). Click onEdit

2. Learner access management.Access the "Access to training courses" category to learn how to manage learners access

3. Module access management

This option is accessible only when the training course has been published

4. Manage banner and thumbnailimages

Once the image has been added, you can replace it, crop it, or download it again. Read the article "How to crop or download my image?" to know more.

2. Duplicate an existing training course

This featureallows to duplicate a training course with the same contents and media, but without the original learners access rules. It is therefore necessary to create a new learner access rule to make the training available.

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course

Click on, fill in the information in the popup window (NameandReference code) and finish by clicking on Saveand your training course will be duplicated.

How to create a training course from web contents (HTML)?

The Teach on Mars solutionallows you to create a training course by integrating web contents.

Note: no statistic will be obtained with a training course from web contents (HTML).

This feature differs from HTML link integration in the dedicated sections of your Teach on Mars Enterprise training portal by:

  • Itsobjective: the HTML training coursefully fits into your educational path, within one of the training categories
  • Itsaccessibility: the HTML training course is accessible in offline mode
  • Itsinteraction: the HTML training course can retrieve elements of the application (for example, basic information about the learner: ID, language, first and last names, ...)

CREATE A WEB CONTENT TRAINING COURSE (HTML)

The processto create a Web contenttraining course is the same as for thecreation of a regular training course.Only the selection of the type of training differs: click onWeb contentinstead of Regular training course.

> CATALOG/Training courses

CREATE THE CONTENT OF WEB CONTENT TRAINING COURSE

> CATALOGUE(Catalog) / Formations(Training courses)> Edition de contenu (Authoring)

Access the Authoring page and click on the Drop archive file heresection or simply drag / drop your .zip file to this area.

You can download a Web content activity template as example, at the top right of the screen.

The final Web content is a.zip filecontaining anindex.html at the root of the .zip archive, essential, as well as all the content to work in offline mode.

La section Version courante(Current version) vous permet de télécharger le fichier .zip actuellement utilisé si la formation était déjà existante.

Remarque:la méthode de compression LZMA n'est pas supportée pour les archives zip.

Lorsque lescontenus de la formation sont chargés dans le Mission Center, le manager a la possibilité de

  • tester sa formation sur sonterminal (tablette, téléphone, WebApp) en Version test,
  • éditer à nouveau sa formation,
  • publier sa formation

En mode Version Test, la formation est visible uniquement par les apprenantsRelecteurs de contenu. Pour plus d'informations, lire l'article «Comment donner à un apprenant le statut de relecteur de contenu ?»

Une fois qu'une formation est créée et publiée, elle n'est, par défaut, accessible à aucun apprenant. Accédez à la catégorie «Accès aux formations» pour plus d'informations.

What is a microlearning training type?

Do you want your learners to managetheir learning pace throughout their training course? This is possible with the microlearning training type.

What is the difference with a regulartraining course? There is no difference except that the learner is free to setup his learning pace.

How to create the Microlearning-type training course?

The processto create a Microlearningtraining course is the same as for the creation of a classic training course. Only the selection of the type of training differs: click onMicrolearninginstead of Regular training course.

Once the training course created, follow the same creation steps asfor a regulartrainingcourse, read the article "How to create training course content for the first time?"

> CATALOG /Training courses

USAGE:

Once the learner has completed the first activity of thetraining course, a window opens offering to customize thelearning paceby selecting the frequency at which thepush notifications will be sent when activities are unblocked.

Once the information completed, the learner can not go further in the training course as the following activities are blocked.

If the learner tries to access a blocked activity, he will see the following window indicating itsaccessibility date.

How to duplicate my training course?

You may need almost similar training course for several populations of your learners (similar except for the media for example or you may have to delete a module or modify the type of an activity, but your training course has already been published (reminder of the article "How to update a training already published?") and no longer allows this modification type.

This article is for you!

1. How to duplicate my training course?

> CATALOG/ Training courses/ your training course / Administration

Click on theDuplicate icon

In the new window, indicate the name and reference of the training course.

Note:the training course name can be identical, but the reference isunique and therefore cannot be the same
Click onSave to save your modifications.
When closing the window, you arrive on the administration page of the new formation.

2. What is duplicated, what is not?

Administration page of the training course:

  • Image of the original training course: duplicated
  • Same category as original training course: duplicated(by default, the training course is duplicated within the same category as the original training course)
  • Modules management (on time) : NOT duplicated
  • Access rules of learners (enrollments): NOT duplicated

Authoring page of the training course:

  • Badges: duplicated
  • Certification:duplicated
  • Modules:duplicated
  • Activities (+ media):duplicated
  • Update message:duplicated
  • Training course description:duplicated
  • Languages management:duplicated

Note: the statistics are not kept because it is a new training course (not published at the time of duplication)

What is the Recommendation Quiz?

SO WHAT EXACTLY IS THE RECOMMENDATION QUIZ?

The Recommendation Quiz is an activity designed to enable you to offer your learners apersonalized learning path, based on their score in a questionnaire-style quiz.

Every question in the quiz relates to a specifictheme, which in turn corresponds to one or several training courses in your catalogue.

When your learners do not get enough correct answers on a given theme you can recommend training courses that will help them reinforce their knowledge and encourage them to start improving in those areas where they are not comfortable.

You can also recommend training courses to learners on themes where they have scored highly. That way they can further develop their expertise on those topics which clearly interest them the most.

In addition, you can enable anGlobal Evaluationoption, which will give your learners insight into their overall level of knowledge on all the themes covered in your Recommendation Quiz.

HOW DOES THE RECOMMENDATION QUIZ WORK?

The Recommendation Quiz is a training course that only includes one activity. It is therefore ideal for promotion directly from the Wall, encouraging your learners to download it straight away at their very first connection to your app. Once they have completed it, they will be guided towards their recommended learning path based on the answers they give and the score they achieve.

DESIGNING YOUR RECOMMENDATION QUIZ

Before you start creating your Recommendation Quiz in the Mission Center, you will need to be clear on what your objectives are:

- What are the main themes featured in your training catalogue? Are you looking to cover all these themes in your Recommendation Quiz?

- What is the target population for your Recommendation Quiz? Do all the learners you are targeting have access to the training courses you'd like to recommend?

- Are you intending to use your Quiz to recommend "expert" training courses to those learners who score highly? Is the plan to recommend training courses that will fill any knowledge gaps or shortfalls on specific themes that your learners' responses identify? Or are you looking for your Quiz to generate recommendations in both these scenarios?

- As well as evaluating the knowledge of your learners on each theme, do you want to add an global evaluation across all your themes?

- How are you going to communicate on and distribute your Recommendation Quiz? If you want every new learner to complete the Quiz as soon as they access your app for the first time, have you thought about creating a dedicated Category at the beginning of your training catalogue?

SOME BEST PRACTICES

Structure your themes

Start by defining the themes for your Recommendation Quiz. You can incorporate up to 10 different themes – but remember that each one will need to have recommended training courses associated with it! You can start from your training catalogue and extract the themes that you build your Recommendation Quiz around. Or conversely, you can begin by defining the themes you want to evaluate, and then identify two or three training courses from your catalogue that fit with them.A recommended training course can be anything from a single Quiz Game right though to a much more sophisticated course with multiple modules and activities.

Write your questions

Every question in your Recommendation Quiz must be associated with one of your themes, and each question has 2 or 3 possible answers.
Each answer corresponds to one of three "levels": correct, incorrect or neutral.

Every theme must have at least one question associated with it. In fact, we recommend a minimum of 3 questions per theme to ensure you get the most meaningful and accurate results possible.

Think about your options

There are two optional parameters you can set when you create your Recommendation Quiz.

Firstly, you can opt for an global evaluation of your learner in addition to an evaluation for each theme: the global evaluation aggregates the results of the learner for all the questions you ask in your Quiz, across all your themes.

You can also activate the option that enables the learner to complete the Recommendation Quiz several times: every time he completes the Quiz, the learner can receive new training course recommendations according to his responses to the questions.

Communicate on the Wall

Don't forget to use the Wall to let your learners know about the Recommendation Quiz when you publish it! If you want all your new learners to complete the Recommendation Quiz the first time they connect to your app, you will have to publish a "Training course" or "Article" communication with a direct link to your Recommendation Quizin first position in your Wall Slider.

You can also create a specific Category for your Recommendation Quiz that you can then position at the very beginning of your training catalogue.

OK, so now you're clear on the objectives and the design of your Recommendation Quiz, let's get down to business and build it!

To do this, see our article "How to create a Recommendation Quiz?"

How to limit the access of a module over time?

Teach on Mars allows you to lock amodule according to different criteria:

  • By code (read the article «How to unlock a module using a code ?»)
  • Undercondition of success of another module
  • By date: this is what we will see in this article!

This feature allows you to pilot a distance learning program over time. You can thus ensure the provision of training course modules one after the other, several days or several weeks apart.

By locking the modules over time, you can also make one or more modules of a course accessible over a given period. This allows you to set up training course campaigns.

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course > Administration

In theModules access managementwindow, click onCreate .

1.Enter dates of availability

Select the module for which you want to indicate locking dates. Choose your start and end dates.

You can choose to indicate only a provision date in the “From” cell and leave the “To” cell empty: learners will have access to the module at from the date entered, with no time limit thereafter.

But you can also choose to indicate only a date in the “To” cell: in this case, learners will have access to the module as soon as they are published (provided they have access to training course!), but for a limited time, until the date indicated.

2. Filter access by population

You can choose to fill in the filters from the custom fields, in order to propose locking conditions for one or more training modules for some of the learners who have access to the training course. You must create a locking condition rule by population (it is not possible to create a rule for several groups at the same time). If the rules concern all learners who have access to the training course, then it is not necessary to fill in the filters.

Note:the locking conditions are automatically disabled if a Profiling activity is present in the training path and recommends activities. If the Profiling does not recommend any other specific module, the condition will work.

How to add an image to my training course?

The training course image is the very first element from which your learners can get an idea of ​​your content. Even if it is not essential to test your training course, it is essential to encourage your learners to download the content you have created.

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course > Administration

How to add an image?

In theImage section, click on. A popup window appears allowing you to access your files on your computer. Select your file and click Open to save your choice.

You must use an image with dimensions of minimum 750 x 545px. You can then zoom in or focus on part of the image.

Where can I see the image on the App?

The image is visible as thumbnail before the training course download

It is also visible when downloading and once the training course has been downloaded

How to modify the training course image?

On mouse over on the image, three icons appears:

: this icons allows to replace the image.By clicking, the window opens and allows you to browse your files and thus select a new image. Finish by confirming your choice.

: this icon allows you to edit the current image. By clicking, it is again possible to zoom in / out the image, or to focus on a part of the image. Finish by clicking Save to save your change or Cancel to cancel the action in progress.

: this icon allows you to download the current image.

Read the article as a reminder « How do I resize or download my image? »

How to access my training course in the Mission Center?

To access your training course, you have two options:

  1. by the menu
  2. using the search

1. Access the training course BY THE MENU:

> CATALOG / Training course

2. Access the training course with the search feature

> CATALOG/Training courses

Note:the search is intuitive, it means that as you inform a string of characters in the search, you will be offered the training courses containing this same string.

You will then,create the training course content for the first timeouedit the content of an existing training course.

How to add a description to my training course?

Why to add a description to the training course?

When you create your training course, you have the possibility to add a description. This description, in a short text format, is aimedat introducing yourtraining course topic in the App.

How to add a description to the training course?

> CATALOG/ Training courses>your training course > Authoring

Fill in theDescription in the fieldreserved for this purpose. Simply change the Edition Language to complete the translation of the description into another language.

After completing theDescription, finish by clickingSave.

For your learners, the description is visible when downloading the training course, and also in the description menu of the training course:

Why and how to add keywords to my training course?

When you create your training course, you can add keywords in addition to a description (read the article "How to add a description to my training course?" to know more).

Why to add keywords?

Assigning keywords to your training course will allow you to find it more easily in your application. In the Search tab of the App menu, the learner can search for a training course by keyword; the suggested training courses will be those whose keyword is contained in the title or description.

AppSearchfunction

How to add keywords?

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course > Authoring

In theKeywordsfield, add your keywords separating them with commas
