How to edit my training course name?

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course > Authoring

All you have to do is change the name of your training course in the Training course's title box provided and clickSave.

How to enroll learners to a training course?

There are three possibilities to enroll learners in a training course:

  1. by an access rule from the training course
    • By filter
    • By email address or login
  2. by an import registration
  3. by the learner account
> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course > Administration

1. ACCESS CREATION BY AN ACCESS RULE FROM THE TRAINING COURSE

Access your Mission Center and click onTraining courses.

Select your Training Course and click onCreatein theLearner access management section.

  • By filter :

You can select one or more filters to enroll your learners

Note :If you click Create without having used any filter, ALL learners having access to the app (registered in the Mission Center with Active status) will have access to the training course

  • By email address or login :

Click onWith email list.

Add your learners either byLogin, either byemail address and finish by clicking onCreate.

If you wish to:

  • erase the rule (to no longer grant access to all learners of this rule), clickDelete
  • modify the rule (add or remove some learners), click Edit.

2. ACCESS CREATION BY IMPORTING REGISTRATIONS

> CATALOG / Training courses

Click on Import training enrollments :

Your.CSVfile template is the following:

Read the article "How to import a learners list?" to learn more about the .CSV downloadable file creationprocess

Note: doNOTmodify the first line of the file (containing the column titles)

Import one or more inscription(s):

In your .CSV file, the fields to be filled in are:

  • learnerId - The user login (mandatory)
  • trainingId - The training reference code (mandatory)
  • accessSince - Date from which the training course is available (optional. If the date is not specified or the date is earlier than today, the training course is available today)
  • accessUntil -Date until the day before the training course is available (optional. If the date is not specified, access is unlimited in time)

Note: To remove a learner access, add an end date in the "accessUntil" column of your.CSV file

Once the import has been successfully completed, a confirmation screen will appear on your Mission Center.

You can also inform the learner(s) by email of the creation of their dedicated access.

Vous pouvez également informer le(s) apprenant(s) par mail de la création de leur accès dédié.

Access management created by CSV import:

Following the import, an access rule is added in eachtraining course concerned by the import.

To modify this rule, you must download againthe attached.CSVfile in each access rules.

This section groups the access to the training course, you find your file there. If necessary, you can modify it and import it again to update the access rights.

3. ACCESS CREATION BY THE LEARNER ACCOUNT

> COMMUNITY/ Learners> your learner

Access the account of the learner you would like to enroll in the training course(for more information on learners management, access articles "How to modify a learner account?"ouHow to delete or deactivate a learner account?)

Click onEnroll in a training course:

Fill in the fields of the popup window by adding the name (or reference code) of the training course, giving a name to the rule (optional) and finish by clicking on Enroll.

To modify or delete this rule, access to Learner Access Management in your training :

  • erase the rule (to no longer grant access to all learners of this rule), clickDelete
  • modify the rule (add or remove some learners), click Edit

How to make training course visible to invited learners?

The Teach on Mars solution allows learners to connect in Guest mode with a limited access to the application.

1. Prerequisites:

  • Guest Mode involves licensing. We invite you to contact your Account Manager for more information on billing related to license management.
  • Ask the Teach on Mars team to enable Guest Mode when deploying the App.

2.

> Catalog/ Training courses> your training course > Administration

In the drop-down menu of the Guest access field, selectDemo.

Finish by clicking onSave.

Invited learners can view the home page and the access to each course depends on how it is configured:

  • "invisible" guest access: it is a private access where the training course is invisible to the guest. It becomes visible (description and training course) and can be downloaded when the guest has authenticated.

  • "demo" guest access: this is a semi-public access where the training course is visible to the guest (description and training course). It can be downloaded when the guest has authenticated.

  • "downloadable" guest access: it is a public access where the training course is visible (description and training course) and can be downloaded by the guest.

Note: The following features cannot be accessed in guest mode:

  • The dual mode
  • The Live! mode
  • The integrated forum
  • The ranking

When the invited learner tries to access these functionalities, a message then asks to create an account in order to access them.

In guest mode, statistical information is accumulated on the user's terminal. When the guest creates a learner account on the application, these statistical data are published (ranking) and fed back to the management interface (Mission Center). Go to the Statistics category to learn more.

How to show a training course demo to guest learners or learners not having access to the training course?

What is a guest learner?

A guest learner is a learner who downloaded and installed the App but does not have an account and is therefore not logged in.

Note: First of all, during the kick-off phase, you must send the request to your project manager that the Teach on Mars teams activate the guest mode in your Mission Center.

What is a learner who does not have access to a training course?

It is a learner with an account and being connected to the App but whose access to the training course has not been given (he/she does not appear in the training access rules).

As from 18.1 version, the demomode allows tomake training visible and / or accessible.

Note: First of all, during the kick-off phase, you must send the request to your project manager that the Teach on Mars teams activate the guest mode in your Mission Center.

How to make an activity visible in demo with the Web authoring tool?

When editing your activity, access the Parameters tab and tick theThis activity is accessible in the demo version of this training coursebox.

> CATALOG/ Training course> Your training course > Authoring > your activity

How to make an activity visible in demo with Excel® activity templates?

> CATALOG/Training courses> Your training course > Authoring

When editing your activity, the popup window appears and allows you to upload your Excel® template. You must tick "This activity is accessible in demo mode box.For guest learners in guest mode, this activity will be visible.

Once your training course published, activities defined as demo activities will be visible to guest learners and learners connected but not enrolled to the training course.

How to give access to a training course with a code?

You would like to give access to one or more learners through a code?

First of all, you have to create an access rule in the Mission Center

CREATE AN ACCESS CODE IN THE MISSION CENTER

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training > Administration

Click onCreatein theLearner access managementsection and selectWith access code tab.

Give a name to your access rule in order to find it back easily and finish by clicking onCreate.

Your access code is generated, you can see it by clicking on the code itself.

How to rename my access rule?

Edit your access ruleand update the "Enter a caption" field :

How to access more information about my access rule?

Click on "More information here", you'll access a popup :

You'll find here :

  • The code to share : hereCI1Y
  • The link to send to your learners. Read the article aboutdirect links to a training course.
  • The QR code you can scan to send to your learners. Read the article aboutdirect links to a training course.

HOW TO ACCESS THE TRAINING COURSE using the CODE IN THE APP?

Ensuite, de leur côté vos apprenants doivent entrer le code de la formation dans l'App, via l'onglet , en cliquant sur l'icône en haut à droite:Learners must then enter the training course code in the App, through theCatalogtab, using the icon top right:

How to remove the possibility of accessing a training course using a code?

You can at any time stop giving the opportunity to enroll in your training course through a code.

For this two options are available to you:

1. Closing the enrollments:

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training > Administration > Learner access management> Edit your rule

Learners who completed the code before registrations closing will still have access to the training course, but no new learner will be able to enroll.

Once in your training course, on the Administration page, in the Learner access management section,check "Close enrollments" and click on "Create"

You then see a confirmation message regarding the closed registrations:

2. Deleting the access rule :

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training > Administration > Learner access management

Click onDelete of your access rule.

No learner will be able to access the training course (including those who entered thecode).

How to set a training course / module as paid-access only?

The process to set a training course / module as paid-access only is the following:

If you have published your App yourself, you will have to provide us with your SKU ID. For this, when your training course has been created, you will have to go in your App from the App store (and/or Play Store). Then you will have to set up the IN APP PURCHASEoption. This option will allow you toobtain aSKUID.

On the other hand, if it is Teach on Mars who has published your app, we create the SKU ourselves on the stores (App Store and / or the Play Store).

Note : If your App is a Webapp, you will have to usePrestashopto get a SKU.

From your App:in the training course content, an activity has a lock as a logo and when clicked, a paid-access popup appears, offering to buy the content.

The modules of your choice can be blocked and made accessible only after purchase within the mobile application or webapp.

Note: If you wish to benefit from this feature and want to know more info, pleasecontact us.

How to make a training course available for a given time period only?

You have the possibility to limit in time the access to training courses contents according to various criteria. This can be done through the import registrations,which should not be mixed with the learners import.

The Import registrations allows to enroll in a training course learners who are not in the Mission Center yet, from a CSV file. You can download a CSV template filein the Mission Center (read the article "How to enroll learners in a training course?").

> CATALOG/ Training courses>Import training enrollments

You can download a sample CSV file by clicking onimport-access.csv.

To limit the access, in this file, it is necessary to fill the "accessSince" and "accessUntil" columns for each learner in the list.

The first column corresponds to the date on which the access begins. The second one corresponds to the date on which the access ends.

Once completed, drag and drop your file or click onChoisir un fichierto be able to browse through your files. Select your CSV file and click on Open.

Note:If you wish to use your own Excel file, read the article "How to import a learners list?" to learn more on saving and format modalities.

How to use Excel® templates?

Create an activity using templates

There are two techniques to create an activity, the web authoring tool or the Excel® templates. In this article, we will focus on this second possibility, which is particularly useful for working with all the "offline" freedom.

The use of the templates is composed of several steps:

  • downloading the Excel® templates on the Mission Center (Internet and Mission Center accesses required for this step)
  • filling the template with your content
  • uploading your template to the Mission Center

The template is an Excel® file structured according to the activity. It is a form to be filled out. You just need to follow the instructions in the document to complete it step by step.

Where and how to download the Excel® templates?

> CATALOG/ Training courses

You can download your template by clicking on “Activity templates”.

"download" icon if you want to download all activities templates.

click on the chevron of the language that interests you > choose the activity > "download" icon

Your template is now available on your computer.

Note: Careful,Teach on Mars regularly updates its Excel® templates, we advise you to always use the Mission Center link by activity to have the latest version.

A little reminder about the differentactivities.

You will find these Excel® templates in the following places:

  • on thetraining courses page(CATALOG > training courses), and also on the training course creation page
  • on the authoring page of a training course
  • in the« Content »chevron of an activity(Download empty content file).

Discover and complete a template

By opening your template, you will see 3 tabs:

  • Instructions
  • Configuration
  • Cards

These 3 tabs appear on all templates. They are nevertheless adapted to the type of activity.

1. TheInstructions will give you all the information you will need to fill in your filepeacefully, including:

  • what is expected for each cell in the document
  • restrictions on the number of characters
  • the possible types of media, the media codes (which you can copy / paste).

2. TheConfiguration tabis particularly extensive in scoredactivities.

3. Thecards tab will allow you to fill in content that will be visible in the App:

  • questions / answers / corrections for scored activities
  • textual and informative content for the Mobile Course activity

There are three types of templates:

  • Scored activities whose Configuration tab is very extensive and whose visuals are customizable.
  • Profiling, Survey, Self-Evaluation / Exercises activities work in the same way.
  • The Mobile Course, whose Cards tab can be almost completely customized. The same is true for the Toolbox activity.

How to use the template for the Mobile Course activity

The Mobile Course allows you to create customized content,to add titles and text to different card modalities that you will be able to layout, but also media such as visuals, videos ...

Insert a media in my activity

To insert your media in your activity you will have to go through 2 steps:

  • indicate in the template the location and mode of appearance of your media
  • import your media into the Mission Center

To know more onhow to insert your media, do not hesitate to read the article of the Help Center.

Layout

You would like to manage the layout of you content, especially:

  • titles
  • alignments
  • bold and italic
  • highligh
  • stylization of quotes
  • (...)

You can do this using our media codes which will be recognized by the Mission Center. To do this, copy the code that you will find in the following table, into the content cell.

Type Subtype Code Option type Option
Insert a media IMAGE [media:name-of-the-file.jpg] Block the zoom of the image (NOZOOM) [media:name-of-the-file.jpg,nozoom]

Enlarge the image (FULL)

 [media:name-of-the-file.jpg,full]
VIDEO [media:name-of-the-file.mp4]
AUDIO [media:name-of-the-file.mp3]
PDF [media:name-of-the-file.pdf] Name the button [media:name-of-the-file.pdf|Texte du bouton ]
Insert a quote [quote:quote|Author of the quote]
Insert a link to a training course [training:reference-code-of-the-training-course]
Layout

TITLE

(H1 bigger, H4 smaller)

 [H1:Title of the card] Tailles du titre

[H2:Title of the card]

[H3:Title of the card]

[H4:Title of the card]

ALIGNMENT

(By default to the left)

>>>>this is right aligned text

 Alignment to the left or centered

<<<<aligned to the left (appears in the cards centered by default)

[h2:>><<The little fox]

>><<centered

HIGHLIGHT

!! This content is important

When uploading your template, the Mission Center interprets and validates your content to display it as it should in the App.

After the import, all you have to do is pass your training course in Test version and enjoy the rendering on your application.

How to create training course content for the first time?

Your training course has been created, you can now edit (create) its content, it means the modules and activities that will compose it.

If you still need to create it, read the article "How to create a regular training course?" for more information.

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course > Authoring


How to create a module ?

Once on the authoring page of your training course, click onNew module to create a new module.Be sure to select the module type from the drop-down list.

Note: to know the difference between the different types of modules, read the article"What are the "Training path", "Toolbox" and "Self-evaluation / exercises" modules?".

How to create an activity?

Once on the training course authoring page, AND in the module in which you want to create your activity, click on New activity to create a new module. On the new screen, be sure to select the activity of your choice and give it a name. Finish by clicking on Save.

1. With the Webauthoring tool

In the selected module, click onNew activity, select the activity-type and fill in the new activity name underActivity Title. Finish by clicking onSave

2. With an Excel® template

In the selected module, click on New activity and fill in the name of the new activity. Finish by clicking on Save.

How to edit my new activity to add content?

There are two ways to create an activity (content):

  1. with the Webauthoring tool
  2. with an Excel® template

1. With the Webauthoring tool

If you use the Webauthoring tool, you must complete the activity

2. With an Excel® template

  • if you use Excel® activity templates,theActivitiessection details each activity and how to complete the associated Excel® template.

The Activity edition popup opens. In this popup, you will be able to drag and drop the Excel® template that corresponds to the activity, in the Drop Excel file herebox.

You can download the Excel® activity templates from theTraining courseAuthoring page by clicking on Activity templates at the top right of the screen

Note:you must complete the "Learning Design" and "Activity Writing" training courses offered by the Teach on Mars Academy. For more information, please send an email toacademy@teachonmars.com

Once your Excel® template dropped, you see that screen (if you use media in your activity, the popup must indicate Missing files.

You must click onMediato drag / drop them

Once your media dropped, you will see Missing media files : None. Cliquez surClose.

Your activity is now complete and saved.

Note: theActivitiessection details each activity and how to complete them using the Webauthoring tool

How to edit the content of an existing training course?

You already have modules and activities in your training course and you would like to modify them?

> CATALOG / Training courses> your training course > Authoring

Pass the training course in "Editing" mode by clicking onUpdate the training

You can now do modifications:

  1. On the modules
  2. On the activities

Note: If the training course has already been published and you are editing it again, you can not modify the activity type anymore. Note that is it not possible either to move an activity from one module to another.

Good to know: Updating an activity has no impact on statistics.

The impacts on the learner side:

  1. The learner will have to download the training course again to access it
  2. The learner will always see that he has already completed the activity and will not be warned that it has been updated

1. How to modify a module?

Click onto modify the module information:

  • with the Webauthoring tool

  • with the Excel® templates

You can modify :

  • the moduleTitle
  • TheLock condition(for more information, access the "Access training courses" section
  • Abstract: if you want to give a brief description of the module
  • Cover: if you want to add a cover image to your module

and finish by clicking on SaveorCancelif you do not wish to save your modifications to the module.

Note: in edit mode, you cannot change the type of a module. Example: if the module is of the “Toolbox” type, you cannot change it into a module of the “Training course” or “Self-evaluation / Exercises” type. The module type option is only accessible when it is created.

2. How to modify an activity?

To access the different activities contained in a module, click on the module name oronicon of the module. Select the activity to modify and click.

With the Webauthoring tool

You can modify:

  • the ActivityTitle
    • Upload Excel® file
    • Manage media
    • Download content
    • Download empty Excel® template file of the activity

But you can also directly modify the cards linked to the activity to modify the texts and the media.

How to delete a card in a Mobile Course?

Click on the deletionicon to the right of the duplication icon

This icon may not be easily visible if the background of your Mission Center is dark there. Simply hover the mouse over the location and the deletion message will appear.

Note: theActivitiesdetails each activity and how to complete the activity using the Webauthoring tool

With the Excel® templates

You can modify:

  • the ActivityTitle
  • Send or upload a new Excel® file: by drag/drop (be careful, this will overwrite the current version) (for more information, read the article "How to create training course content for the first time?"
  • Download the current Excel® template by clicking onCurrent version
  • Modify media: by clicking onMedia

Once the training course content has been edited and updated, you can again pass the training course status to Testing or Publication. Access the "Training course test and publication" category to know more.

Note: theActivitiesdetails each activity and how to complete the associated Excel® template

How to integrate a "Web link" activity to a training course?

It is possible to integrate a web link within a training course, by creating aWeb linkactivity in aTraining pathmodule. This web link is visible when the learner is online only.

How to CREATE a WEB LINK ACTIVITY

> CATALOG / Training courses> your training course

1. Using the Webauthoring tool

Click onNew activityto crate an activity and selectWeb linkin the activity type. Give a name to your activity and click on Save.

In the new page, in theContenttab, you can insert a web link in theLinkfield. You can, if necessary, modify the activity name. In the Parameters tab, you can define if the activity is visible or not in the Demo mode.

2. Using Excel® template

Click onNew activityto crate an activity and selectWeb linkin the activity type. Give a name to your activity and click on Save.

Then, for the new created activity, click onto edit it.In the new Activity editionwindow, you can insert a web link in the Link field. You can also define if the activity is visible or not in the Demo mode. Click onSave to finish.

What is the rendering in the App ?

Pass your training course inTest versionin order to be able to see your new activity on your mobile device.

How to modify a Web link type activity ?

> CATALOG / Training courses> your training course > your Web link activity

By selecting your activity, you will be able to modify its name or the link.

How to integrate a web activity?

It is possible to integrate a web content into a training course in your Teach on Mars app.

Note: what follows is related to theWeb contentactivity within a classic training course and not to a Web content-typetraining course.

This allows you to reuse training content that you already have (for example, from a previous LMS, provided this content is mobile-friendly), but also to create new kinds of activities that are not yet proposed by Teach on Mars (eg Virtual Reality, Augmented Reality ...).

To learn how to create a web content, you can use the following documentation:Documentation Web Activity / SCORM(last update on February 27th 2020).

This document relates thegolden rules to follow to use a Web content.

Here is anexample of content created with Articulate Rise

Time, scores and points are escalated if the activity itself has been well developed to return time, progression and score to its output or if the activity is SCORM compatible.

You can the use these contents to organize competitions as points will be appear in the ranking.

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course

1. Using the Webauthoring tool

Click onNew activityto create an activity and selectWeb contentin the activity type. Name your activity and click onSave.

In the new screen, in Content tab, you can drag / drop your .zip file archive.You can also define if the activity is visible or not in theDemomode. Click onSaveto finish.


You can also define whether the scores are sent so that they can appear in the results reports.

Pass your training course inTest versionto see the new activity in your mobile device

2. Using Excel® templates?

Click onNew activityto create an activity and selectWeb contentin the activity type. Name your activity and click onSave.

Then, for the new activity, click on to edit it.In the Activity edition, you can drag / drop your .zip file archive or click on the Drag archive file here.You can also define if the activity is visible or not in theDemomode. Click onSaveto finish.

You CANNOT define if the scores are sent so that they can appear in the results reports.

Once your archive is loaded, you can download it again at any time using theicon


Note: The archive cannot exceed 200MB and it is common to all the languages ​​of the training course. Content translations must be managed within the content.

How to modify a Web activity?

To modify a web activity, simply load a new .zip archive which will overwrite the old version.

Notes:

  1. Please note that Flash is not supported in web activities.
  2. When inserting the .zip file in a Web Content type activity, the name of the file in the Mission Center becomes the concatenation of the reference code of the activity and the (numerical) id of the activity. Therefore, when an existing archive is replaced, there does not appear to be any change but the content is replaced.

  • ToM-Memo-reglesdor-SCORM - EN.pdf
    40 KB Download
  • articulate.zip
    10 MB Download
  • ToM-Memo-reglesdor-SCORM - FR.pdf
    40 KB Download

How to unlock a module under condition of success of another module?

Teach on Mars allows you to lock a module according to different criteria:

  • By date (read the article "How to make a training course available for a given time period only?")
  • By code (read the article "How to give access to a training course with a code?")
  • By condition of success of another module of the training course (eg: module 4 of your training course will only be unlock if module 3 is succeeded), we will see this in the present article.

How does the unlocking of the module work ?

It is preferable that the module contains at least one scored activity.

  • If the module contains multiple scored activities, it must see the successful completion of those scored activities AND the completion of other activities to unlock the linked module.
  • If the module contains no scored activity, it must see the completion of all the activities composing it.

How to activate the locking of the module ?

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training > Authoring

Click to edit your module (read the article "How to edit the content of an existing training course?" if you know no more how to modify an existing module).

Select the Unlock this training course after success of "My first module" module value of theLock condition drop-down menu and finish by clicking onSave.

So, to unlock a module, you just have to follow the same process but selectThis training course is not locked in theLock condition drop-down menu and finish by clicking onSave.

Notes:the locking conditions are automatically disabled if a Profiling activity is present in the training path and recommends activities. If the Profiling does not recommend any other specific module, the condition will work.

How to manage translations of training content?

The languages ​​available for your Teach on Mars solution are determined when creating your project. Once these languages ​​have been configured by the Teach on Mars team, you can then, for each course, decide on the languages ​​available to the learners.

Notes:

1. if you upload a new version of an Excel® template of the training course default language, all the content of the translations will be lost when reopening them with the Webauthoring tool.

2.RTL languages (ie. arabic, hebrew...) only work withExcel® templates. This is a current limitation.

Training course creation

Read the article "How to create a regular training course? »

In theDefault language, select the main language of your training course in the drop-down list.

1. Translation using the Web authoring tool

> CATALOG/ Training courses> Your training course > Authoring

The authoring language can be modified from the first Authoring page

However, it can also be modified directly from the activity. It is also recommended to check the authoring language each time an activity is modified.

1.1. Translation of a mobile course

For the translation of a Mobile Course, once your language selected, you see two cards.

To the left, it is the card with the original language, to the right, it is the card where you can insert your translation based on the original card

1.2. Translation of a scored activity

For the translation of a scored activity, you simply need to click on the cell to see the text in the original language

Fill the Gap example

Pick a Word example

Notes:

  • do not forget to translate the activity title, it is not automatic
  • the elements of a card can be different from one language to another but you must have the same number of cards (same number of questions)

2. Translation of your training course using Excel® activities template

> CATALOG/ Training courses> Your training course > Authoring

Selected languages in your window will be proposed to the learneras of the next publication of the training.

You must therefore ensure that the content in the selected languages has been fully uploaded beforehand in the Mission Center.

Select all language through theChange language edition and complete the corresponding contents the same way youcreated your training coursein the default language.

How to export the content of a training course?

Perhaps you have created your training course using the web authoring tool, and now you would like to retrieve the content? This is perfectly feasible using the functionality for exporting / importing activities.

Note: this feature is available from version Callisto 3.0 of the Mission Center.

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course > Authoring

1. Exporting your activities and media

Export of content is carried out activity by activity. It is not possible to download the content of all the activities belonging to your training course with a single click.

Two options are available to you for downloading the content and media of your activities:

Option 1 : exporter the content from the training course structure

You can export the content of your activities by clicking on the download arrow, without having to enter the editing mode for each activity.

  • Select thelanguagein which you want to retrieve your content (it is possible to download several language versions at the same time)
  • If you also with todownload the mediaassociated with your activity (image files, audio, video and PDF documents), make the corresponding selection
  • Click onDownload.

Option 2 : exporter the content whilst editing the activity

When you are in the process of authoring or editing your activity, you can at any time decide
to download the automatically saved content.

  • Click on theUpload / Download button)
  • Click onDownload Content
  • Select thelanguage in which you want to retrieve your content (it is possible to download several language versions at the same time)
  • If you also wish to download the mediaassociated with your activity (image files, audio, video and PDF documents), make the corresponding selection
  • Click onDownload.

Note: you can also download your media by selecting "Manage media" from the drop-down list.

2. What format do I retrieve my content?

The content of your activities is downloaded in the form of Excel® templates.

  • The parameters of your activity are in the Configuration tab
  • Theconclusion of your activity is in the Configuration tab
  • Thecustomization options(changes of background, cursors, etc.) are also found in the
    Configuration tab
  • The content of the cards or questions in your activity can be found in the Cards tab

When you export the content of an activity including the media, you download a .zip file containing:

  • The Excel® template(s) named as follows: course name - activity name - language code(EN / FR / ...)
  • A "media" folder with as many sub-folders as there are languages selected for download. You will find the media available in each of the training course languages.

Once the content has been exported, you are free to modify it directly in the Excel® template if you wish in order to reimport it

3. Which elements are exported and which are not?

When you export content, you can download:

  • the up-to-date Excel® templates in each of the languages available for your activity
  • all the media items integrated into the activity

The items not currently downloaded are as follows:

  • the training course title, keywords and description
  • titles of the modules and titles of the activities

If you need these elements, for instance for the purpose of translating your course to create an additional language version, you will need to put them into a separate Excel® file.

You have now successfully exported your content?
Why not find outhow to import training course content using the Excel® templates?

How to import the content of a training course?

Perhaps you created your activity using an Excel® template, or else you have exported your content and wish to re-import it after modification? Here's how to proceed.

Note: this functionality is valid for Mission Centers where the web authoring toolis enabled.

> CATALOG/Training courses> your training course > Authoring

1. Importing the content of an activity

To import your Excel® template, go into the editing mode (Authoring) where you edit your activity.

  • Click on the Upload / Download button
  • Select "Upload Excel file"
  • Click on "Browse file" to browse your computer or drag and drop the file

At this point, there are two possible options:

Option 1:The media declared in the Excel® template have already been integrated into
the web authoring tool beforehand. In this case, no action is required: the web authoring tool
is simply updated with the content of your file.

Option 2: the media declared in the Excel® template have not yet beenintegrated, or new media need to be added. In this case, a new pop-up window will appear to allow you to integrate the media either by drag and drop or by clicking on "Browse file" to browse your computer to the relevant folder.

2. Importing an Excel® template to add a translated version of the content

Perhaps you need a new language version? If you wish to integrate a translated version of an activity, proceed as follows. Go to the mode for editing (Authoring) your activity, choose the target language in which your activity needs to be updated, then import your translated template.

If the media are the same as in the original version of your activity, there is no need to upload them again: they are already integrated. If new media have been declared in the translatedtemplate, you will be able to upload them after integrating your design template.

You can also edit your translated content directly in the web authoring tool interface.

Note: the title of the activity is not exportable, and therefore is not automatically updated when the content is imported. It must be added separately in the web authoring tool.

Also:
How to export the content of a training course

How to test my training course before its publication?

You have finished editing your training course content, and you wish to see the result in your App befoire publishing your training course and make it available to your learners? It is possible!

How to pass the training course in Test version?

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course > Authoring

Click onCreate a test version.

Select the language and fill in your Update message (optional) then click onCreate.

Note: a message informs if there is no access rule created for the training course.

The green dot which was on Editing, turns yellow under Testing, then green once the Test version is available.

How can I see that my training course is in Test version in the App?

Open your App on your mobile device, log in with a user having thecontent reviewer status. You will see your training course appear with theTESTmention.

You are now ready to publish your training course (read the article : "How to publish my training course?".

Note: If this training course has already been published, you can not delete any module or activity, neither to modify an activity type (e.g. change aWordspoolfor aQuiz Game). Also, it is not possible to move an activity from one module to another.For more information, read the article "How to update an already published training course?"

How do I publish my training course?

Once your training course tested (read the article "How to test my training course before its publication?" for more information), you can publish it.

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course > Authoring

Click onPublish training course

A message is displayed :«You are about to publish your training course. If you wish to add or edit an update message for your learners, click on "Cancel", otherwise, you're all set!».

Confirm your choice by clicking on "Confirm publication" in the new popup.

The green dot previously visible in Testing is now in yellow (while processing) under "Published", then in green when publication is done.

How to update an already published training course?

Your training course has been published and you would like to update it?

Note: If this training course has already been published, you can not delete any module or activity, neither to modify an activity type (e.g. change aWordspoolfor aQuiz Game). Also, it is not possible to move an activity from one module to another.For more information, read the article "How to update an already published training course?"

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course > Authoring

To modify your training course content, simply click on theUpdate the trainingbutton, and your training course will pass on Editing status

You then have the option of:

  • Edit title and description
  • Rename activities and modules (read the article: "How to edit the content of an existing training course?")
  • Add modules
  • Upload / modify activities content (read the article: "How to edit the content of an existing training course?")
  • Change the conditions for unlocking modules (open, unlocked with a code, unlocked under the condition of success of another module, limited in time)
  • Modify certification
  • Enable/disable ranking and badges


When you have updated your training, you can test it again and finally publish it in your application.

Excel® activity templates in Callisto: What's New?

Notice to content creators, whether you prefer to download them regularly or keep them warm on your computer, this message is for you.

The new version of the Teach on Mars solution called Callisto includes an update of the Excel® activity templates!

WHAT MUST BE REMEMBERED ABOUT THESE NEW EXCEL® TEMPLATES?

It is now possible to copy / paste the content from the Instructions tab; you will be able to easily copy / paste the media codes!

You no longer need to delete the pre-filled content in the Cards tab: your Excel® activity templates are now delivered empty.

Do not worry, we keep all the examples of Introduction and Conclusion texts to inspire you!


This approach, you will understand, will simplify your experience with Excel® activity templates.

4 IN 1!

In this spirit, we have merged the Mixed Course, the Flash Course, the Learning Quiz into theMobile Courseactivity so that you can create these 4 types of activities using a single Excel® template!

The introduction of the Mobile Course has been removed from the configuration tab, you just need to create an Info type card in the cards tab if you wish to introduce your content.

TIME MATTERS FOR THE WORDSPOOL

Who says new Excel® template, also says activity evolution, so the new Wordspool Excel® template allows you to configure the activity time!

WHAT'S GOING TO HAPPEN TO YOUR EXISTING EXCEL® activity TEMPLATES?

Regarding the content already created with Excel® activity templates, they are still taken into account.

If you need to create new content, we recommend that you download the new versions.

What is a scored activity?

A scored activity, when completed, will give a final score to the learner.

This score thus becomes a key element of the activity success or not.

What are the scored activities:

  • Challenge
  • Fill the Gap
  • Pick a Word
  • Sushi Game
  • Training Game
  • Wordspool
  • Quiz Game

In the app, scored activities show a small cup to the right of their name.

For a more detailed understanding on how scored activities work, read the article "How do scored activity work?"

To find out more about other types of training activities; read the article"Training activities dashboard"

How to create a direct link (or QR code) to an activity?

1. DIRECT LINK TO A TRAINING COURSE

You can obtain a QR code for an activity. This code will allow the learner to open the activity from a communication or an email.

Once clicked, the link is automatically copied to the clipboard and the following window appears:

:click to be redirected to the link address

:click to copy the link address again

:click to download the QR code

Note: it is not possible to have a direct link to Toolbox or Self-evaluation / Exercises activities

WHAT IS THE BEHAVIOR OF THESE DIRECT LINKS?

  • On a phone with the app installed, the app will be launched and the learner will be redirected to the content
  • On a phone that does not have the app installed, the webapp will be launched but the home screen will prompt the learner to install the app (default webapp screen if the screen is too small)
  • On a non-mobile device, the webapp will be launched and the learner will be prompted to log in
  • If the training course is already installed, the learner will directly access the activity, otherwise, he will be invited to download the training course (taking into account that the learner is enrolled and can access it). For information, read the article ondirect link to a training course.
  • Limitation: It is currently not possible to have a link to an activity from inside a web activity. We recommend to create a separate web link activity instead.


Note: This feature must be enabled by the Teach on Mars team. Do not hesitate to contact your Project Manager at Teach on Mars.

To know more about the Web activity

To know more about theWeb link

Best practices

How to name my media?

Only the alphanumeric characters (a-zA-Z0-9), underscore (_), dash (-) and period (.) are allowed for media naming. Spacesoraccentsinmedia names are no longer allowed as from April 30, 2020.

How do I manage my image media in translations?

When translating content, whether through Excel® activity templates or the Webauthoring tool, the same image can be used (as long as it does not contain text that would require translation). This can also apply to videos (see the next point concerning subtitles).

How to manage my video media in translations?

It is very easy to create multi-language courses using a single video and inserting subtitles directly in the Mission Center.

Read the article "How to manage videos in training course activities?" to review how to add video subtitles.

What image quality should I use?

An 80MB image will not be of better quality than a 2MB image on a mobile device. However, you must make sure that the width is 1024px minimum.

Reminder of the articles "How to use the media in activities?" for the image formats to be used and "What are the ratios, sizes and formats of your media to use when creating your training courses and activities?" for the image sizes and ratios to use.

How can I change the dimensions of my image or zoom it?

Read the article on resizing or the zoom option to learn more about this new option.

How to compress your videos and save time when loading them?

Surely you've waited too long for a video to load on the Mission Center? Or for it to be hosted online when it is integrated into a training course or communication? Or even, you may have seen this process fail for various reasons, in particular regions of the world where the connection is a little more limited (ex: Russia, China)?

But have you put the odds on your side? Have you uploaded a video whose weight is consistent with its use? Keep in mind that your videos are mainly played on smartphones and therefore that ultra-high definition is not necessarily necessary.

Note :The video files mustnot exceed 80MB except the video-type communication limited to 50 Mb. Read the article"How to manage videos in training course activities?"

Which free tool to use for the videos compression?

When you are concerned about sending videos, at Support Teach on Mars, we check your videos and their weight / quality / duration ratio and sometimes we allow ourselves to compress them using a fast tool, Handbrake.

Here are a few screenshots of how we use it on a 41MB video for 31 seconds, which seems a bit heavy.

We open Handbrake (to download fromhttps://handbrake.fr/downloads.phpand install on both Mac and Windows) and choose the video via the "Open source" button.

Once done, we choose the compression settings.

In order to obtain a good quality / weight ratio, it is recommended to simply modify two parameters:

  • the definition in 720p
  • and the number of frames per second at 25

Start processing the video by clicking on the "Start" button at the top.

The result is convincing: the compressed video only weighs 10MB, or four times less!

And we can launch the two videos side by side, the quality has not been altered in any way:

What is the advantage of compressing a video?

Thanks to the compression performed on the video, we have just gained 30MB of disk space,

  • time saved to upload this video to the Mission Center,
  • as much time and space saved for the learner if he/she downloads the training course in "Offline" mode.

How to use media in training course activities?

> CATALOG/ Training courses> Your training course > Authoring > your activity

1. USE OF WEB AUTHORING TOOL

Note: the Mission Center renames the media with a unique identifier when it is loaded, it is mandatory for the export and import of good media with good content

Select theModuleand edit theActivity

A new window appears offering the possibility toBrowse file:

For each added image, you have two options:

  1. Zoomoption, allows the learner tozoom the image,
  2. Full optionwill display the image on the whole screen.

To add a video, an audio extract or a PDF document, just select the right item:

  • Add video
  • Add audio
  • Add document

1.1. How to replace a media in a training course created with the Webauthoring tool?

a) replace an image

On mouse-hovering the image, click onand a new window will appear allowing you to browse your files on the computer to select another image.

b) remplace a video

In the upper left corner of the Video insert, click and select Change video source. A new window will appear allowing you to browse your files on the computer in order to select another video.

1.2. How to replace / add a media in a training course previously created using Excel® templates?

Click on the Upload / Download button, then selectManage media

A new window will open and you will see all the current or expected media (.srt, vignettes). A simple drag and drop will allow the integration, it will overwrite media with the same name.Example, if a media (my-image.jpg) is referenced in several places (whether in the default language or in one or more translations), all occurrences will be replaced

2. Use of Excel® activity templates

Note: if you modify a media, all media with the same name will be replaced, even in the translations

Select theModuleand edit theActivitéfor which you would like to manage media. Click onMedia :

You will be able to:

  • drag / drop the media you would like to upload.
  • download an existing media
  • delete an existing media Remove

The Teach on Mars solution can host three types of media in training course activities but also PDF files. These media have certain restrictions, here they are:

AUDIO

Fileformat:MP3

Definition:128kbps

Naming convention in Excel activity templates:

[media:my-audio.mp3] wheremy-audio= the name of your audio file

IMAGE

Fileformats:JPG / JPEG / PNG

Definition:width: 768 Pixels / height: free

Remark:For illustrations, prefer Landscape layout. Images must be inRGBand not in CMYK, 72px resolution.

Naming convention in Excel® activity templates:

[media:my-image.jpg] ormy-image.jpg ina column only hostingan image*

My-image= name of your image file

Note: *some columns in the Excel® activity templates are specific MEDIA columns and therefore do not require the use of [media:] tags, you just have to write my-image.jpg

VIDEO

Fileformat:MP4 in h.264

Definition:720precommended

Naming convention inExcelactivity templates:

[media:my-video.mp4] wheremy-video= Name of your video file

Note :The video files mustnot exceed 80MB. Read the article"How to manage videos in training course activities?"

PDF

Fileformats:PDF

Naming convention inExcelactivity templates:

[media:my-doc.pdf] wheremy-doc= the name of your PDF file

HOW TO NAME MY MEDIA?

Only the alphanumeric characters (a-zA-Z0-9), underscore (_), dash (-) and period (.) are allowed for media naming.Spacesoraccentsinmedia names are no longer allowed as from April 30, 2020.

How to manage videos in training course activities?

Video insertion in a training activity is managed the same way as for any other media (image, audio, PDF), read article for more details"How to use media in training course activities?".

Note:A video file can not exceed 80 Mb and must be in .MP4 format

Unlike other media, when you insert a video into an activity, you can also add:

  • subtitles files
  • a video thumbnail (image used when the video is not playing). The recommended width is 768 px / height is free

TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS TO ADD A 360° / 3D VIDEOS:

  1. subtitles are not supported for these 360° / 3D videos
  2. 3D videos only are not supported, the Mission Center will accept them, but they will not be correctly displayed
  3. A 3D video must be 360 ° in order to be correctly displayed
  4. 3D video formats are up / down
> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course > Authoring> your activity

use of the Webauthoring tool

If you use the Webauthoring tool, to add a video, click on and selectAdd video

How do I add a thumbnail to the video?

By default, the thumbnail displayed is the first frame of the video. However, you can choose your own thumbnail by uploading the image to your Mission Center.

For this, when you load your video, you will also be able to upload an image file that will be used as thumbnail for the video.

This image must be in .jpg format, indeed, the .png format is not recognized for this functionality.

Click on the icon on the left of your video managementwindowand select Edit thumbnail. You can then drag and drop your file.

Note: adding thumbnails from the video menu works ONLY for videos loaded by the Web authoring tool.

How do I add subtitles to the video?

Subtitle files are simple text files (created in a text editor such as notepad or other) whose name is that of the video they accompany and the extension is SRT. The file name must also contain thelanguage code.

Here is an example of a subtitle file:

1

00:00:10 --> 00:00:15

sous-titre 1

sur deux lignes



2

00:00:22,315 --> 00:00:26

sous-titre 2



3

00:00:35 --> 00:00:40

sous-titre 3

As you can see it, three elements compose the subtitle:

  • Its number (1, 2, 3,…).
  • The display start and end time codes.
  • The text of the subtitle on one or more lines.

On the other hand, each subtitle is separated from the next by a line break.

About the language code (before the .SRT extension and preceded by a "."), here are some examples :

The file must also be inserted in the video management window.

Note: the encoding must be in UTF-8.

Add a 360° video?

As for the thumbnails, click on the icon on the left and chooseSelect video type.

In the new window, click on 360° video andconfirmyour selection.

Use of Excel® activity templates

Select theModuleand edit theActivityfor which you would like to manage the media. Click onMedia :

You will be able to:

  • drag / drop the media you would like to upload.
  • download an existing media
  • delete an existing mediaRemove

How to add a video thumbnail?

By default, the thumbnail displayed is the first frame of the video. However, you can choose your own thumbnail by uploading the image into your Mission Center.

For that, when you upload your video, you will also have to upload a file nameofmyvideo-thumbnail.jpg.

For example, if the video is named myvideo1.mp4, you have to upload myvideo1-thumbnail.jpg. It is this image that will be used as a thumbnail.

This image must be in .jpg format, indeed, the .png format is not recognized for this feature.

The image must also be inserted in theMediawindow.

If the Web author tool has since been activated on the Mission Center, to insert a thumbnail you will need to access the content menu to insert the thumbnail.

Click on the Upload / Download button, then selectManage media

Then drag and drop your thumbnail file.

Note: adding a thumbnail using the Manage media option in theContent menu ONLY works for activities completed using the Excel® templates, and dragging and dropping the thumbnail file in the media window.

How to add subtitles to the video?

Subtitle files are simple text files (created in a text editor such as notepad or other) whose name is that of the video they accompany and the extension is SRT.The file name must also contain thelanguage code.

Here is an example of a subtitles file:

1

00:00:10 --> 00:00:15

sous-titre 1

sur deux lignes



2

00:00:22,315 --> 00:00:26

sous-titre 2



3

00:00:35 --> 00:00:40

sous-titre 3

As you can see it, three elements compose the subtitle:

  • Its number (1, 2, 3,…).
  • The display start and end time codes.
  • The text of the subtitle on one or more lines.

On the other hand, each subtitle is separated from the next by a line break.

The subtitle file must have the same name as the video file and will be in .SRT format.

About the language code (before the .SRT extension and preceded by a "."), here are some examples:

If the video is called myvideo1.mp4,

  • for French subtitles, your file will be called myvideo1.fr.srt
  • for English subtitles, your file will be called myvideo1.en.srt
  • for Italian subtitles, your file will be called myvideo1.it.srt
  • or Spanish subtitles, your file will be called myvideo1.es.srt
  • etc.

The file must also be inserted in the media management window.

Note: the encoding must be in UTF-8.

HOW TO NAME MY MEDIA?

Only the alphanumeric characters (a-zA-Z0-9), underscore (_), dash (-) and period (.) are allowed for media naming.Spacesoraccentsinmedia names are no longer allowed as from April 30, 2020.

"Shared" video management between the default language and translations

A video uploaded in an activity of the default language is automatically shared in all translations, except if it has been replaced in one or more translation(s).
In the Webauthoring tool, if a video has been replaced in a translation, the only solution to share the video again from the default language, is to create agin the card in the default language, upload the video and redo the translations of the card.

PLAYING VIDEO CONTENTS ON APPLICATIONS

When downloading a course, the learner can choose whether or not to use the offline mode. If the training contains one or more videos, in the case of the offline mode, the video contents will be downloaded to their device. Otherwise, the videos are not downloaded and the learner will need an internet connection each time he wants to watch a video. This will be done by streaming.

By default, the offline mode is disabled to limit the storage space used by the app on the learners' mobile.

Note: If a video has been downloaded to the learner's mobile, he can delete it at any time in order to increase his memory space.

Streaming mode

Offline mode

How to manage the display of images in training course activities (full, no zoom)?

The Teach on Mars solution allows you to integrate images in certain learning activities of your training course.

By default, images can automatically be zoomed. On the other hand, you have three options to change the display of your images:

  1. Default Imagedisplaying
  2. Zoom optiondisabling
  3. Image size maximizing

Note:These options are only available for images inserted in a text(with format [media:my-image.jpg] wheremy-image= your image file name)

1. DEFAULT IMAGEDISPLAYING

The images sizes are recalculated to fit within a rectangle as wide as the text and as high as 35% of the screen.

An icon in the upper-right corner of the image is automatically added to indicate that the image can be enlarged. Clicking on it setsthe image to full-screen mode

Naming convention:[media:my-image.jpg] wheremy-image= your image file name

2. ZOOM OPTIONDISABLING

If the zoom option is disabled, the zoom icon will not be displayed and the image will not be zoomable.

Naming convention:[media:my-image.jpg,nozoom] wheremy-image= your image file name

3. IMAGE SIZE MAXIMIZING

In this case, image sizesare recalculated so that the image is displayed as wide as the text, regardless of its height.

Naming convention:[media:my-image.jpg,full] wheremy-image= name of your image file

Note:Zoom option disablingandImage size maximizingoptions can be combined: [media:my-image.jpg,nozoom,full]wheremy-image= name of your image file

How do I resize or download my image?

As soon as you insert an image, whether in an article, a category or an activity, you will be able to use new functionalities.

When mouse overing the image, three icons appear.

How to replace the current image?

Click on, a new window opens and allows you to choose a new image that will replace the currently used image.

How to use the crop tool?

Click on, a new window opens and allows you to focus on a part of the image.

How to download the image?

Click on, the image will be downloaded and saved on your computer.

What are the learners rewards?

Learners receive:

  • Points (which allow to set a ranking, read the article "How are learners points calculated?")
  • Badges (read the article «What are the badges delivered to learners?")
  • Scores (scored activities also give points, read the article "How do scored activities work?")
  • Certifications (certifications are optional, read the article "How to provide a certification to your learner?")

How can I see which badges I have earned and which ones I still have to obtain?

From the Profile tab, you access the badges of all the training courses you have started / completed.

How to see the learners ranking within a training course?

A learners ranking is accessible from the App if the trainer has decided to activate the ranking for the training course from the Mission Center (read the article "What is the learners ranking within a training course?"

Once in the training course, access theicon to see the learners ranking for this training course

You can than see the learners Top 3 for the training course, as well as your placement in the ranking.


How to see the badges received or to be made for a given training course?

Once in the training course, access theicon to see the badges you have earned, as well as the badges you still have to get, for the training course.

How does learners ranking work?

A ranking by training course is offered to learners in all Teach on Mars applications. The learners access their personal ranking directly in their application and can thus compare their score with that of their colleagues!

The top three learners in the training are represented in the top 3.

The learner's place and points, as well as the learners who precede and follow him in the ranking (with their points).

The display of the ranking is optional.

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course > Administration

Edit theDetailssection, whether check or not the Enable ranking box and finish by clicking on Save

As a manager, you can you can define the population you want to include in the ranking.

Once the ranking activated, click on

The Rankingoptionswindow opens. Then select the filters you want to apply to define the scope of the ranking. The learners will then have the same value for the different criteria chosen.

The managercan also have access to this ranking(see the article : "What is the classification of learners within a course?")

To learn more about how points are calculated, read the article "How are learners points calculated?"

How do scored activities work?

The score is calculated according to the percentage of correct answers from the learner. Example: the activity includes 10 questions, the learner answers correctly to 8 questions, he will have a score of 80%.

Scored activities can be compatible with additional functionalities (read the article "What is a scored activity?"):

  • Badges
  • Live!
  • Shake’n’Learn

This score is used to determine different elements:

1. In the Mission Center:this score allows to elaborate statistics with the following indicators (read the article "What is the csv export of statistics?") :

  • Progress
  • Score, success
  • Assiduity (attendance)
  • Deployment
  • Points

2. The validation or not of an activity :in other words, we define in the Excel® template of the activity the minimum score to obtain. This threshold must be passed for the activity to be validated.

Once the activity validated, a grey star turns golden to confirm that the activity has been successful.

3. The validation or not of a module: the module is validated if all the scored activities of the module have been successfully completed. This allows for example to issue a certification (read the article : "How to deliver a certificate to a learner?") only if a module is validated, or else, tomake available another module which was blocked under condition of success (read the article "How to unlock a module under condition of success of another module?").

Rankings are available for learners on their App. The manager must activate the display of the ranking for Learn on Mars and Teach on Mars Enterprise Apps. This ranking shows the 10 learners with the score closest to the learner.

For the managers, in the management interface and in Excel report export, the ranking offers filtering options.

How are learners points calculated?

Learners earn points every time they perform an activity. If ranking is activated in a specific training course, learners are ranked according to their number of points in this specific training course. Information about learners' points is also available in the Mission Center.

Quick reminder: points are different from the score (see the article about score :"What is a scored activity?")

Learners can earn points with all types of activity. The amount of points earned depends on performance and number of attempts. It follows different rules depending on the type of activity.

Here's how points work for each family of activities:

1/ Non-scored activities (except Flash Game and Brainstorming)

Non-scored activities are:Mobile Course,Learning Quiz,Flash Course,Mixed Course,Survey,Profiling

  • When the learner ends such an activity for the first time, 10 points are earned.
  • When the learner ends the activity again later, 1 point is earned.
  • Once the learner has finished this activity 5 times, no more points will be earned.

2/ Flash Game

  • When a learner sees a card for the first time, 2 points are earned
  • When a learner returns a card, 2 points are earned
  • When a learner sees a card they have already seen, 1 point is earned
  • Once a learner has finished this activity 5 times, no more points will be earned.

3/ Scored activities (except Quiz Game)

Scored activities are:Challenge,Fill the Gap,Pick a Word,Training Game,Wordspool,Sushi Game

  • The amount of earned points is based on a "Maximum" of 50 points. When the learner succeeds at a scored activity, they earn a percentage of that "Maximum", which correspond to their percentage of correct answers. E.g. With 80% of correct answers, the learner earns 40 points. (80% x 50 points = 40 points).
  • Bonus: If the learner answers all questions with no mistake, the amount of points is doubled
  • Bonus: If the learner succeeds at the activity on the first attempt, the amount of points earned is doubled
  • Once the learner has finished this activity 5 times, no more points will be earned.

Example: if a learner succeeds at a scored activity with no mistake on first attempt, he earns 200 points (=50x2x2).

4/ Quiz Game

Learners earn points at the end of a Quiz Game according to these rules:

  • A correct answer to a newly viewed question is 5 points
  • A correct answer to a question they have already replied to is 1 point
  • If the learner reaches the target before the end of the timer, they earn a time bonus. For example, if there is 20% of the whole time remaining, they earn a 20% bonus on the points earned from the correct answers
  • If the learner gives only correct answers, points are doubled.

Example: If a learner scores on first attempt 10 correct answers out of 10 in 40 seconds (the whole timer being 50 seconds), the amount of points is:

  • 10 answersx 5 points = 50 points
  • which are doubled since the learner answered all questions correctly
  • with a time bonus of (20% x 50 points =) 10 points

The final result is 110 points.


There are also bonuses related to Quiz Game in duel mode, which are added after the opponent answers the duel.

  • 50 points when the learner wins
  • 10 points when the learner loses
  • 25 points in case of a tie between players


NB: Quiz Game is not affected by the limit of points after a number of attempts.

5/ Brainstorming

Learners earn 1 point for each vote on a proposal they have posted in a Brainstorming activity.

6/ Recommendation Quiz

Even if the Recommendation quiz is not an activity but a training course type, learners can also earn points:

  • When the learner ends such an activity for the first time, 10 points are earned.
  • When the learner ends the activity again later, 1 point is earned.
  • Once the learner has finished this activity 5 times, no more points will be earned.

Note: Toolbox and Self-Evaluation/Exercises are not concerned by points.

Further reading:

To learn more about other types of rewards, read "What are the learners rewards?"

How to a provide a certification to your learner?

You can generate a certification for one or more modules of your training course for your learners, in PDF format, fully customizable.

Note:

  • This feature is only enabled on request.
  • the module is certifying: you must finish and succeed all the scored activities of the module to trigger the certification obtention

> CATALOG/Training courses> your training course > Authoring

On the right, check theCertificatebox

Select the module (s) for which you wish to issue a certificate in the Choose one or more modules section and click OK to confirm your selection.

Then select the certificate template from the Choose a PDF template drop-down list. You can also add the email address of a recipient who will receive a copy (Add email CC).

Note: The module (s) to be certified must contain at least one activity score.

Don't forget to check the Automatically send certificate to learners box so that the certificate is sent automatically and you have no action to take when the learner has successfully completed the required module(s). This option is selected by default.

Once created, the certification module is identified with a specific icon :

Note: This option will take effect on the next publication

You can change the certification by performing the same steps and clicking Certification again.

To deactivate a certification on a training course, simply select no certifying module.

What are the badges delivered to learners?

What are badges ?

Learners receive badges if the Manager has activated the option in the Mission Center. These same badges are visible on the learner's personal page from the Profile tab:

but also directly in a training course


They are automatically assigned in the following cases:

Meaning To do Done
Flawless on a scored activity
Completed training course
Flawless on all scored activities of the training course
Success on a certified module

In the Mission Center, managers see the badges earned by the learner from the learner's individual report on a training course.

  • A badge is allocated to the learner if he successfully completes a faultless activity, with the type of activity in detail:

Challenge

Training Game

Pick a Word

Fill the Gap

Wordspool

Sushi Game

Quiz Game
  • A badge is allocated to the learner if he completes a training course

  • A badge is allocated to the learner if he completes the training course AND passes a flawless for all its scored activities

  • A badge is allocated to the learner if he succeeds the certification in a training course

Note: Badges do not earn points, they are part of the awards. For more information on other types of rewards, read the article "What are the learners rewards?"

How to activate badges in a training course?

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course > Authoring

At the bottom right of the Authoring page, check the Badges box.

Note: Thisoption will take effect the next time the training course is published.

What are the general statistics of all training courses?

On the Mission Center Homepage, general statisticsof the Teach on Mars solution are displayed.

> CATALOG/ Training courses>Reports

This statistics page displays different elements

Note: All data, except State of your training courses, can be filtered either by category or based on the custom fields of the learners accounts.

1. State of your training courses:

State of your training courses allows to see in details the training courses never published, published but not available to learners, published

2. In average, a learner has ...:

In average, a learner has...details by learner training courses not started, started, completed

3. Average time spent per learner:

The average time spent per learner indicates the time spent by learner on training courses. This statistic is represented as Top 5 / Flop 5

4. Average progress per learner

Average progress per learnerindicates the average progress by learner on training courses. This statistic is represented as Top 5 / Flop 5

5.Deployment ratio

The Deployment ratio indicates the number of training coursesmost used, the number of learners who have started it or being enrolled to it.

Click onSelect a main category:

and choose the main category for which you would like to see the key indicators

How to obtain a detailed view of the key indicators by filter (custom field)?

Click onFilters:

and fill in the information of the different custom fields.

Finish by clicking onApply.

Note: If you made an error in one of the custom fields, click onResetto erase the data and start again from the beginning.

How to export key indicators in Excel® format?

Click onExportto be able to consult these key indicators in an Excel® report.

and select

  • thereport language
  • the export by activity or by training course

What are the detailed statistics per training course?

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course> Key indicators

This statistics page presents the data below, which concerns only the selected training course (even if they are visually very close to general statistics)

  • Training penetration rate
  • General training course information (key figures)
  • The history of the training course penetration rate
  • The enrolled learners behaviour

Note: All data can be filtered either by category or based on the custom fields of the learners accounts.

How to obtain a detailed view of the key indicators by filter (custom field)?

Click onFilters:

and fill in the information of the different custom fields.

Finish by clicking onApply.

Note: If you made an error in one of the custom fields, click onResetto erase the data and start again from the beginning.

How to obtain the key indicators over a defined period?

You can select a period for which you want to obtain the key indicators.

Note: This option will only update the History of the penetration rate and the Behavior of registered learners.

Click on the calendar

You have different options:

  • Last 30 days
  • Last 3 months
  • Last 12 months
  • Custom: use the calendar to define start date and end date

Click onApply to confirm your selection.

How to export key indicators in Excel® format?

Click onExporterto be able to consult these key indicators in an Excel® report.

and select

  • thereport language
  • the export by activity or by training course

Other statistics about the training course are available:

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course> Learning analytics

1. Progress

This section of statistics presents the following elements:

  • Average training course progress
  • Average progress per module: average progress and access rate per module

2. Scored activities

  • Average score: average scores of learners having started the training course
  • Average results: success rate of scored activities

You can, from this section, download reports on Challenge activities

3. Certification rate:

This section shows the number of certificates obtained for the training course.

A button allows you to download all the certificates that have been issued for this training at once (for a given period or not).

You can also obtain the information for a defined period (see above).

2. Ranking

Read the articleWhat is the learners ranking within a training course?

3. Exercises reports

Read the article What information can I get in the "Exercises report"?

4. Survey reports

Read the article How do I get my learner's answers to Survey activities?

5. Individual reports

Fill in the field with the name of the learner for whom you want statistics:


Note: the search is intuitive, this means that as you type text in the search bar, you will be offered learners whose name or login contains this text.

For the learner you have selected, you can see the following statistics:

  • Time spent in training course, progress in training course, number of points
  • Summary view of dates of first and last activity on training course, number of activities launched
  • Information indicating if the learner has been certified (or not) for the training course
  • Badges received by the learner
  • Progression by module (of the learner)
  • Results: success and failure of the learner in the scored activities of the training course

What is the training courses ranking?

Note: As from 18.1 version

You can access the most popular training courses ranking.

> CATALOG/Training courses>Ranking

You access the list of the most popular training courses. You can choose to see the ranking:

  • by training course started (standard option)
  • by completed training course
  • by time spent on training course

How to find a training course?

Have you created a training course and need to modify it? But your catalog is very extensive and you need to find it quickly? This article is for you!

Direct search in the menu

Click on the search iconto the right ofTraining coursesandtype in the box provided for this purpose the letters of a word contained in the name of the training course or in its reference. A list of five training courses containing these letters appears and you can click on one of them to open it.

Search in the training courses home page

> CATALOG/ Training courses

1.By the category in which the training is found

Select the category name and all training courses contained in this category will be proposed to you.

You can at any time use the arrows at the bottom of the page (middle) to change the page or modify the number of views per page on the right.

2. By the name or reference of the training course

Type in the box provided for this purpose the letters of a word contained in the name of the training course or in its reference and click on. The training courses appear and you can select the course you want to edit.

3. By training course type

It is also possible to select one or more types of training courses (Training / Microlearning / Web content / Recommendation Quiz). Confirm your choice by clicking Apply.

Why am I unable to upload my Excel® templates in the Mission Center?

While uploading Excel® activity templates,sometimes someerror messages are displayed : this means thatinconsistencies were discovered and have to be resolved to be able to upload the template.

First situation: characters excess

The most common error message may concerns the characters excess. Indeed, when you fill your Excel® activity templates, it is important not toexceed the characters limit, provided in the Instructionssheet (and / or in the columns title).

Second situation : specific errors regarding activities

You canencounter other kinds of errors during the Excel® activity templates uploading, which will concern specific activities. In that case, when you create a testing version of your training course in the Mission Center, a clear error message is displayed. This message includes:

  • the activity template language which contains errors
  • the activity ID. You can open the activity and see the error message (the line to modify in the Excel® activity template)
