Note:The above mentioned problems are the most common ones, however you may encounter another problem, and then contact our teams at support@teachonmars.com

Why is my training course not displayed in the App?

1. You reached this step and your training course is not displayed in Test version?

Several reasons may be causing this problem, you should check:

  • Training course access: it is important to know that once your training course is in Test version or published, it is, by default, unavailable for learners even for the training course editor. Thus, to make the training course available, it is necessary to create one/several access rule(s) in the section Learner Access managementsection, (read the article "How to enroll learners in a training course?"

  • The content reviewer status: when you create a Test version of your training course, it is crucial to give your learner account the content reviewer status (for more information, read the article "How to give a learner to content reviewer status?".
  • Update your App :the issue of visualization may be due to your App version.It is therefore recommended to update your App.
  • Check that you have not deleted the category associated with your training course: if your training course is associated with a category that was subsequently deleted, then your training course will no longer be visible, so you must associate your training with another category (for more information, read the article "How to add, delete and edit categories within the training catalog?".

2. The training course is not displayed once published

Points 1 (on access), 3 (on version) and 4 (on category) are also relevant if the training course is published.

What are the "Training path", "Toolbox" and "Self-evaluation / exercises" modules?

This article details the three module types available for the composition of a training course.

Select theModule type (read the article "How to create training course content for the first time?" to learn more about the content creation).

1. TRAINING PATH MODULE

This module allows the learner to learn,train and validate what has been learned.
It includes the following activities:

  • Web activity
  • Brainstorming
  • Challenge
  • Fill the Gap
  • Flash course
  • Flash Game
  • Learning Quiz
  • Mobile Course
  • Pick a Word
  • Profiling
  • Survey
  • Sushi Game
  • Quiz Game
  • Training Game
  • Wordspool

2. THE TOOLBOX MODULE

This module isconsistently placed at the end of the training course and is only composed by theToolbox. It allows the learner to consult,whenever he likes, training course data.

3. SELF-EVALUATION / EXERCISES MODULE

This module can only containExercisesandSelf-evaluation. activities. The Apply phase is placed at the end of the training course pace and is aimed to determine the learner's Exercisesbased on the acquired knowledge.

How to use filters and custom fields?

Note : custom fields can only be created / modified byasuper Adminaccount

Custom fieldsspecified in learner accounts allow you to set up filters on the information in order to obtain a more concise display containing only the necessary data. You determine them when you create your Teach on Mars solution.

They can be modified at any time and supplement the mandatory fields, namely:

  • Login
  • Password
  • Status: Active (A) or inactive (I)
  • Content reviewer: Yes or No

Note:for the status,Activeis the default value

How to use custom fields?

>COMMUNITY/ Learners> Custom fields


You can create multiple custom fields as you wish to. (Examples of custom fields: Company, Department, Country, ...).
Note: Do not use parentheses in custom fields.

Filters can be used in the Mission Center but also for Excel® export statistics:

  • To allow multiple values ​​for a custom field, check the Multi-values ​​box
  • To use the filters only in Excel® reports, check the Only in export box
  • To deactivate a custom field, check the Archive box

How to use filters?

Filters are used for many displays in the Mission Center:

  • HOME / Key indicators: Analysis of training course or learner statistics on a filtered population
  • COMMUNITY/ Learners: Selection of a filtered population of learners
  • COMMUNITY / Communications/ Create: Messages created for a filtered population of learners
  • ADMINISTRATION/ Managers /Filtresheading: Gives managers access to a filtered population of learners
  • CATALOG/ Training courses:View on the Training courses of a certain category. Then allows to give access to a training course to a filtered population of learners, in the ToM Enterprise application via the Manage access to learners section.

What are used multi-values fields for ?

These are used in the profile, for example, to perform a search. However, they cannot be used subsequently for the filters of the access rules or the rules for sending communication. Values ​​must be separated by commas ",".

Example:

  • A learner works for two subsidiaries of a client. There is a Subsidiary custom field.
  • Several subsidiaries companies exist for a client (Lyon, Paris, Marseille, Bordeaux).
  • The learner working for Paris and Marseille will have in his profile under the Subsidiary field: Paris, Marseille
  • When we do our search to see all the learners in "Paris", this one will appear together will all learners in Paris. It will be the same if we carry out a search containing "Marseille" together will all learners in Marseille. We will also find by searching for "Paris, Marseille" but we will not find it by searching for "Marseille, Paris".

Therefore, it can be concluded that in the profile, the comma is considered as and and, but in a search, the comma takes the full string of characters.

You can put two values in a field on a profile. If we do a search, on one or the other value, the learner will appear in both cases. You cannot put two values in a field when you do a search, or when you select a population of recipients.

How do I import a learners' list?

There are two methods to import a list of learners:

  1. Import from the example file downloaded from the Mission Center
  2. Import from your own Excel® file

Import from the example file downloaded from the Mission Center

You can import a large number of learners at once, from a single Excel® file.

> COMMUNITY/ Learners> Import / change

You can directly download the template file from the Mission Center by clicking on theimport.csvfile

In the Excel® file, complete the information of your learners:

  • Login (mandatory)
  • First name (mandatory)
  • Last name (mandatory)
  • Email (mandatory)
  • Password
  • Status A = Active / I = Inactive (mandatory)
  • Sandbox_tester (content reviewer Y = yes / N = no) (mandatory)
  • Metadata if already filled in (optional)

Finish by clicking on Import now after having imported your csv file.

Note: the file must also be saved asUTF 8 CSV format

Import from your own Excel® file

If you use your own Excel® file, verify if it is saved under UTF 8CSV format:

  • Open your Excel® file containing your learners list
  • Go to "File" tab
  • Click on "Save as" and select the "CSV (separator: semicolon)" file-type, then click on "Save

  • The following message should appear.

  • To encode your CSV file in UTF-8, open it in a text editor: Notepad on Windows (Start Menu> All programs> Accessories> Notepad) or TextWrangler on Mac.
  • Click on the "File" menu, then "Save as" and in the "Encoding" drop-down list, choose "UTF-8".It is absolutely necessary to choose the semicolon as a separator, indeed commas, even in UTF-8, are not working.
  • After saving it, your file is encoded in UTF-8: you can upload it to the Mission Center.

Note: if the file includes already existing accounts, they will automatically be updated.

How can I create a learner's account?

The Mission Center allows tocreate, update anddelete learner's accounts.It is possible to manage their access to Apps linked to the Mission Center.

An active learner's account gives the learner access to the Apps managed by the Mission Center.

Account creation

> COMMUNITY/ Learners> Create

Fill in the Login, Password, Lastname, Firstname, Email, and other custom fields. You can add other learners by clicking Add.

Finally, finish by clicking on Validate

Note: you can select the Send an email to the newly created learners check box if you want your learners to be informed when their account is created.

How to modify a learner account?

There are two ways to modify a learner account:

  1. from the learner profile
  2. from the menu, by csv file import

1. How to modify the learner account from his/her profile?

> COMMUNITY/ Learners> learner's account

Once on the learner's profile, click onto modify the learner's profile. You can not update the fields of the learner's account:

Finish by clicking onSave

Read the article to know more about thecontent reviewerstatus.

2. How to modify the learner's account from the menu by csv file import

> COMMUNITY/ Learners> Import / Change > Import / update learners

You can also modify learner's accounts using the import (read the article "How to import a learners list?" if you do not know how to import a learners list.

Tick the necessary boxes:

  • Deactivate learners whose logins are not in the file: will delete all learners not present in the file and previously created
  • Do not create new learners (the import will only update existing learners): to be used to avoid duplicate accounts to change for example the learner's content reviewer status, or their active / inactive status

How to give a learner the "content reviewer" status?

The Mission Center offers the possibilityto test a training course and toallow some learners to check the content before publishing it.

To do this, the training course must be inTest Versionand the learner must:

  • Haveaccess to the training course(see theAccess to training coursessection for more information)
  • Have theContent reviewer status

This status allows the learner to access a training course which is in Test version (it appears in the App with the Test mention) and therefore to test it before authorizing its publication.

> COMMUNITY) / Learners> learner's account

Once in the learner's profile, click onto modify the learner's profile.You can now tick the Content reviewerbox:

How to merge two learner's accounts?

> COMMUNITY/ Learners> Import/ Change > Change login / Merge learners

The import works the same way as for the learners list import :

You can directly download thelogin.csvtemplate file from the Mission Center.

This file includes two columns only to be filled in:

  1. oldlogin
  2. newlogin

Finish by clicking onImport now once your csv file import done.

How does the learner's accounts merge work?

The import allows the administrator to import a CSV file with two columns:

  • oldlogin: the login from which the data will be transferred
  • newlogin: the destination login (either the new login, or the account to which the data will be transferred)

A summary screen of the number of merges or moves (or errors) is shown before the administrator can confirm the action.

Notes:

  • If the oldlogindoes not exist, an error appears on the confirmation screen
  • If the newloginalready exists, the data is merged into the newlogin account and the oldlogin account is deleted with all associated data. Oldlogin learners are logged out of the App.
  • If the newlogindoes not exist, the oldloginis renamed by the newlogin. Learners are not logged out of the App.

How to delete or deactivate a learner account?

There are three ways to delete a learner account:

  • from the account / profile thereof
  • from the list of learners
  • from the menu (import of learners), by csv file

1. How to delete a learner's account directly from his/her account?

Note :This feature is only available from version 17.4

> COMMUNITY/ Learners> the learner's account

From the learner's account page, click onto the right of the name to delete the learner's profile

Note: For the 16.9 version, after having selected thelearner whose access you want to modify, click on Edit in the Learner details section. In the popup window that opens, click on Inactive in the Status field. The deactivation is effective from the next log in of the learner.

2. How to delete a learner's account from the learners list?

The manager who wishes to delete mass learner accounts must have theCan delete learners massivelyrole. Read the article "What are the managers rights?" if you would like to know how to attribute this role.

> COMMUNITY/Learners

From the learners list, select the accounts you would like to delete and click onDelete learners

3. How to delete a learner's account from the menu, by csv file?

> COMMUNITY/Learners> Import/change> Delete learners

You can directly download the csv template file from the Mission Center

How can I get my learners' answers to Challenge activities?

In the 18.3 version, a new report gives access to statistics on learners' answers to each question in the Challenge activities.

If your training course contains at least one completed Challenge activity, a new Challenge answerstab becomes available in the statistics screen of your training course.

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course > Challenge answers

This new screen is structured in 3 parts. At the top, the usual filters which will allow you to select the population of learners on which you will consult the statistics.

Bottom left, a first selector that allows you to choose the Challenge activity for which you want to see the statistics. By default the first challenge of the course is selected. Below, a double selector allows you to select the version of the activity.

First, an explanation is needed

When you modify the questions or the answers of a Challenge, a new version is referenced in the Mission Center when you publish your training course (even if it was only a spelling correction), and this in each language. Each version can have different questions and a different structure, that is why we have to differentiate them. Learners who then answer this Challenge will be linked to the new version, in the language they have chosen for the training course. If, however, no change to the Challenge is noted in the new publication, learners will always answer to the same version as before the publication.

This second selector therefore allows you to select the language and version of the activity that will determine the visible answers in the statistics.

As soon as a version of a challenge is selected, the statistics are displayed by question. The questions are those present in the selected version. And for each of them, a graph shows the distribution of learners on each answer as well as the number of participants.

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course > Learning analytics

In order to have a more complete view of the responses, a CSV export is also available. To obtain it, click on the Export button to the right and select Export by "Challenge" activities

The file will list, for all the training challenges, for all the learners selected by the filters, the answers of the last connection of each learner, whatever the version. For each answer from a learner, the export specifies:

  • The version
  • Language
  • The question
  • The answer selected by the learner
  • Success / failure on the question
  • The expected correct answer

What are the detailed statistics per learner?

> COMMUNITY/ Learners> the learner account

The reports section allows you to directly access learner statistics by training course.

You will see :

  • the time spent by the learner in the app (even for deleted training courses)
  • his assiduity (attendance)
  • the number of shares
  • the number of likes

Note: the time spent indicated on the learner files and on the learner profile includes the time spent in training courses (exercises and courses) but also the time spent on articles. However, the time spent on articles does not appear in reports.

A statistics page appears:

  • Synthetic view of the dates of first and last activity as well as the time spent in the training course.
  • The possibility of exporting learner reports by training course
  • Certification: if the training course contains a certification module, the individual report specifies whether the learner is certified or not.

The learner has not been certified yet :

The learner has been certified (and you can see the date of the certification), you can alsodownload the certificate orsend the certificate again:

What information can I get in the "Exercises report"?

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course > Exercises report

This statistics page shows the following information:

  • Self-evaluation completion: number of learners having completed the Self-evaluation activity
  • Most recommended exercises: number of times each exercise has been recommended
  • Average training course progress (on exercises of learners having completed the Profiling activity)

How do I get my learner's answers to Survey activities?

> CATALOG / Training courses> your training course > Survey reports

Select from the drop-down menu the Survey activity for which you want to see statistics:

The following page shows the statistics of the answers to the questions of yourSurveyactivity:

What is the custom fields ranking?

Note: As from 18.1 version

You can access the ranking of custom fields. For example, you can display a ranking of your countries, zones, sectors, managers, departments, or any other custom field that you have configured in your Mission Center.

> CATALOG/ Training courses> your training course (optional)>Ranking

Going down on the page, in the drop-down list, you can choose the custom field for which you want the ranking.

You can use filters for your ranking and also associate the search result with a custom field. You can also define a period for your search using the calendar.

Read the general article to know how to use the filters or how to choose a date range.

In this example, ranking by custom field: Country

You can then classify the custom field in question according to the following criteria:

  • by started training course
  • by completed training course
  • by time spent on training course

What is the learners ranking?

Note: As from 18.1 version

You can access the learners ranking.

> COMMUNITY/ Learners> the learner's account >Ranking

You can use filters for your ranking and define a period for your search using the calendar.

Read the general article to know how to use the filters or how to choose a date range.

You reach the list of the 20 best learners. You can choose to see the ranking:

  • by points
  • by spent time
  • by startedtraining course
  • by completed training course

How to find a learner?

Do you have a lot of learners to manage and want to find one in particular quickly? This article is for you!

Direct search in the menu

Click on the search iconto the right ofLearnersin the menu and type in the field provided for this purpose the first letters of the name, first name, login or email address. The auto-completion system allows you to choose from five options:

  • If your learner appears, select him/her and access the learner's account.
  • If your learner does not appears in the list, it is preferable to go directly to the Learners page.

Search from the Learners page

> COMMUNITY/Learners

1. By the name, first name, login or email address of the learner

Type in the field provided for this purpose the first letters of the name, first name, login or email address of the learner and click on.

Learners whose last name, first name, login or email address match your search appear. You can then select your learner to access the learner's account.

If your learner does not appear:

  • Check the spelling of your search
  • Prefer a first name or a last name to an email address for example (where it is easier to make a mistake)
  • If (s)he still does not appear, it is because the account does not exist!

2. By learners status

On the learners page, it is also possible to select one or more status types by clicking onSelect a learner status: Enrolled / Unenrolled.

3. By filter

Click onFiltersand in the custom field(s), indicate the search elements. Finish by clicking onApplyto save your search elements.

What to do in case of forgotten password?

You have forgotten your password? No stress!

On the login page, Click onForgotten password?

Creation of account using an email address:

Enter your email address. A link to create a new password will be sent to you automatically.

Which statistics can be accessed by the learner?

The learner accesses their own statistics in their personal dashboard. He accesses it by accessing the Profiletab.

Key indicators

This space contains several statistics:

  • Temps total: the time spent in the app doing exercises or reading articles
  • Completed training courses:the number of completed training courses
  • Points: the number of points acquired by doing activities

Badges

Displays won (in red) and to be won (in grey) badges.

Do not hesitate to click on a training course to access it again, or download it if it has been deleted from your mobile device in the meantime.

Notes:

  • Learners statistics are synchronized between the different devices as soon as the learner logs in on a new terminal (read the article "How are statistics synchronized if the user changes devices?"). In the case of open access training course (no authentication), a new account is created on each device, which leads to a new statistical account when the learner creates a nickname.
  • These statistics are reported in the management interface made available to trainers.

What data are stored on the learner?

1. The Teach on Mars App allows to collect several statistics

They are stored in the Teach on Mars databases. They are partly offered on the statistics page of your Mission Center (read the article "What are the general statistics of the app?") but also used anonymously as trend curves.

  • Parameters for defining the learner accounts selected and given by the clients / learners, none of which is mandatory: last name, first name, e-mail, ...
  • Learner data when completing a training session:
    - Location: time zone
    - Internet connection type : wifi, offline, 3G, 4G etc.
    - Phone brand + software version
    - Phone language
    - Teach on Mars App language
    - Audio mode (vibrator, alarm, etc.)
  • Data linked to Teach on Marstraining courses:
    • Answers given by the learner to training activities questions
    • Learner account status : active <> inactive
    • For each of the training activities done by the learner:
    - Time spent (secondes)
    - Progress (percentage)
    - Score (percentage)
    - Success (boolean)
    - Acquired points

2. List of data exchanged with the Statistical reporting app

Among the stored data listed above, only the following data is offered to the managers of the training courses:

  • Settings for defining learner accounts
  • Data linked to training courses

3.Data storage: Why? For who? Where?

Data are stored:

  • Partly on the learner's phone, in this case nobody can access it
  • In the secure Teach on Mars data center, in this case:
- The customer can access the data via the statistical reporting application
- Teach on Mars IT can also access it

4. Data volume unchanged

The volume of data depends on the consumption that the user makes of the App, as well as the amount of content embedded in the App.

However, data consumption is low, as it is only a text data exchange which in the vast majority of cases will not exceed a few megabytes.

Note: there is no interaction. The data is used for educational purposes and is not published on social networks (Facebook, Twitter, etc.)

What is the Wall?

What is the Wall?

The Wall is your application's homepage - the first page your learners will see when they open your app. Via the Wall, you can send communications to your learners to:

  • Inform them of what's new in your company
  • Guide them through the application
  • Promote the training courses of your catalog and facilitate the access
  • Make them want to come back to your app!

The Teach on Mars solution offers 6 different types of communications:

  • The Article, that you can create with text, media and links, perfect to deliver information or learning content
  • The Video, posted with a Player button, that the learner can launch directly in the app
  • The Web Link, to create traffic on your corporate websites or on your social media
  • The Image, that will be displayed full screen on your app, perfect for a teasing campaign
  • The Training Course link, to promote the training courses of your catalog and guide your learners through their learning path
  • The Short Text, a text in 140 characters, perfect to contact your learners with a Push Notification.

You can mix formats and build your editorial plan over time.

In addition, learners will be able to see directly in their Wall if they have been challenged in the Quiz Game activity and thus, try to beat the score of their opponent!

What are the options of the Wall?

Each sent communication offers several options for the learners:

  • "Like" (this option can be activated when creating the communication)
  • "Share" (with this option, the learner can share the communication on his/her own social media. This option can be activated when creating the communication)
  • "Bookmark" (by default on all the articles sent)
  • "Push Notification" (this option can be activated when creating the communication)

The structure of the Wall

The Wall is divided into 3 sections:

  • The "Wall Slider" or "Communication Banner", to promote the most important or the latest communications. The Wall Slider can accommodate up to 5 different communications.
  • The "Newsfeed", where every communications sent can be found thanks to its infinite scroll
  • The "Bookmark" section, where the learners can find all the saved communications

How to send a communication to a learners list?

There are two ways to send a communication to several learners.

1. From the Learners page

> COMMUNITY/Learners

You can now select a list of people to send a communication to.

Read the articles onthe communications creation if you need additional help.

2. Depuis la page Communications

> COMMUNITY/ Communications

You can directly type the login of the learners to whom you wish to send the communication, a suggestion will help you find your recipients:

Once enrolled, the number of learners in the Targetindicates the number of targeted learners

Note: It is also possible to copy/paste a logins list (separated by a comma).

How to manage the translation of your communications?

It is possible for you todirectly translate your communications. To do this, access your communication. Your communication was created in English and you have to translate it into French? Nothing's easier ! Edit your communication.

Note: If you opt for the push notification option, the text of the notification can be translated into all the languages ​​of your communication creation

You can see the default communication language again

In the Enabled languages ​​box, select the languages ​​for which you want a translation.

As soon as you click to save your choice, the new language(s) will appear

Click to save as draft to access the drop-down menu allowing you to change your editing language.

You can now select the language (French) of the communication to start the translation.

You now know that you are editing the French language:

You can therefore translate the title and description of your communication.

The title and text blocks appear in the original language. You just have to click on the block to be able to edit it and translate the text in the new language (French).

If for some reason the original language (English) needs to be changed, click Save and translate to save your work before changing language

Just like when creating the original article, you must fill in the fields with the translation.

  • How can I send an Article commmunication type?
  • How can I send a Video communication type?
  • How can I send a Web Link Communication?
  • How can I send an Image communication?
  • How can I send a Training Course Communication?
  • How can I send a Short Text Communication?

If everything is ready, you can directly click on Save & translate to have your translation taken into account when sending your communication!

Note: If the selected default language upon creation of the communication was not the correct one, you can change it. However, you will have to copy / paste the text in the new default language by saving (Save and translate) at each step of the page before changing the editing language.

How to create a deeplink (or QR code) to a communication?

It is possible to create a direct link to a communication so that it does not get lost in the newsfeed, and so that it is easily accessible for learners.

On the Mission Center homepage, click on Communications.

On mouse-overing the communication, click on the link icon:

Once clicked, the link is automatically copied to the clipboard and the following window appears:

: click to be redirected to the link address

: click to copy the link addressagain

: click to download the QR code

What is the behavior of these direct links?

  • On a phone with the App installed, the App will be launched and the learner will be redirected to the content
  • On a phone that does not have the App installed, the Webapp will be launched but the home screen will invite the learner to install the App (Webapp screen by default if the screen is too small)
  • On a non-mobile device, the Webapp will be launched and the learner will be invited to connect
  • Limitation: It is currently not possible to have a link to a communication from inside a web activity. We recommend to create a separate web link activity instead.

Note: this feature must be activated by the Teach on Mars team. Don not hesitate to talk about it with your Project Manager at Teach on Mars.

How to send communications on the Wall of my App?

How to use communications so that they appear in the Wall?

> COMMUNITY/ Communications> Create communication

Select theCommunication type in the section provided for this purpose.

We invite you to access the Wall: the types of communications section which shows the different types of communications.

In the Mission Center, the manager can see the number of Likes and Shares of communications, as well as their Top/Flop. But also, the number ofLikes andpartagesof each learner.

The manager can create his avatar which will be displayed on all communications, read the article "How to modify the Manager profile?" to know more.

Articles that can be of interest:

-What are the Wall statistics?

How to update the Home Banner of the App?

> COMMUNITY/ Communications> Create communication

Whencreating your communication, remember to check theShowcase the communication by displaying it on the Wall sliderbox.

What is the rendering in the App?

The upper banner of the application homepage displays the last five communications that the learner has received.

To know the different types of communication and how to send communications to learners, read the articles "What is the Wall?» and all about thecreation of communications.

Communications are sent from the Mission Center thanks to a "Manager" access (read the article "What are the managers rights?").

Note: It will be possible to have different banners according to your groups of learners thanks to the filters (read the article "How to use filters and custom fields?". If no filter is specified, all learners managed by the manager responsible for the communication will receive it.

Managers can update and delete communications. This will update the application banner (and the learner's inbox). No push notification is then sent.

How to create a communication template?

What exactly is a communication template used for?

A communication template can be shared by a super admin (main administrator of the Mission Center) with other administrators. All these local administrators need to do is transform the template into a communication, manage the options (push notification, like, comment, etc.) and send!

By using communication templates, you can help your local administrators in their roles asfacilitators of the Wall, and ensure that the messages sent to learners are consistent, adapted to the promise of your application and to your company's culture.

How to create a communication template?

> COMMUNITY/ Communications>Create a template

Reminder: You can only create a communication template from a "super admin" account.

Create your communication template the same way you create a communication:

  • How to send an Article-type communication?
  • How to send a Video-type communication?
  • How to send a Web link-type communication?
  • How to send an Image-type communication?
  • How to send a training course-type communication?
  • How to send a short text-type communication?

Once the content of your article has been created, all you have to do is click on Save astemplate at the bottom right of the screen

How to transform a template into a communication?

Reminder: a communication template cannot be sent. It must first be transformed into a communication by the super admin or by an administrator with the "Can send communications" role

Imagine you've been informed that a communication template has been created and you need to use it to send a communication to your learner group.

Simply proceed as follows:

> COMMUNITY/ Communications>Manage

How to access the template?

1. The communication templates are recognizable because they are labelled Template. You can easily find the communication templates by filtering the list by Status:

On mouse-overing the template, four icons appear:

  • : to view or edit the communication template. A communication template can only be
    edited by a super admin.
  • : to delete the communication template;
  • : to duplicate the communication template;
  • : to create a communication from the template.

When you click on, the communication is created from your template:

You can now edit and complete this communication:

  1. Choose your target (the learners to whom you want to send your communication)
  2. Choose the default language and adapt the communication in this language
  3. Display the communication on the Wall Slider
  4. Select your options (enable sharing, likes, comments and push notification)

As a reminder, these points are detailed in the article onhow to create an Article-type communication?(points 2, 3, 6 and 7).

Save or send?

Perhaps you would like to translate your communication and send it to learners in different countries? Start by saving it as a draft. You can then deal with the translation directly online.

Once everything is ready, just click on Send to get your article straight to your learners!

How to create a new template from an existing communication?

Reminder: this action is only possible from a super admin account, which is the only type ofaccount that can edit new communication templates.

In the same way as if you were going to edit an existing template, access your templates.

On mouse-overing, click on to create a communication from the selected template.

When you click with the mouse, the template is created:

You can see that it is pre-filled with the information contained in the communication.

How to send an Article-type commmunication?

Article-type communications offer you a framework for creating and structuring a complete communication using different "blocks" containing text, media or links. Articles can be used as a new way of delivering learning content - without requiring you to create a training course and activities - or simply of bringing information to the attention of your learners.

How to create an article-type communication item from the Mission Center ?

1. Choose "Article" as the communication type

> COMMUNITY/ Communications>Create communication

TheArticleis the first communication-type available, it is than checked by default.

2. Choose your target

Select your recipients by choosing one of the 3 available options:

-Send to all learners(checked by default)
-Refine with filters(to send your communication to a group of learners from your custom fields)
-Refine with emails/logins(to send to a list of learners)

3. Choose your language of publication (edition)

You can now set a default language for your communications and manage translations directly in the Languages section. Read the article on management of languages in articles.

4. Header section

4. A. The Header image

The header image is the visual that learners will see first when they click on your communication. It is also the image that is previewed when the communication is in the Wall' news feed.

The size required for the header image is 750 x 270 pixels (resolution 72 pixels), in JPEG or PNG format. To integrate your image, click on the "Image" box or drag and drop.

You can choose a slightly larger image and use the Mission Center's zoom-in/zoom-out feature.

Note: You must include a header image - without it, you will not be able to publish or save your communication.

4. B. The title of the communication

The title of a communication can be up to 60 characters long. Make it as engaging as possible. Why not personalize it with your learners' first names, for instance? Read the article"How can I customize with the learner's information?"

Note: You must include a title - if it is not completed, you will not be able to publish or save your communication.

4. C. Wall Layout

When your communication is presented in the Wall's news feed (as opposed to the Wall Slider), the default layout is as follows:

However, you can opt for a different layout in order to make the news feed more dynamic. To do this, choose the optionImage on the left / Text on the right... Or the other way round! You will need to upload a new 240 x 280 pixel image.

5. Content section

5. A. The description

Add a short description for your communication: it will be displayed with the header image and title in the news feed.

The description is limited to 180 characters.

Note: You do not have to include a description: if you don't fill it in, you will only see the title of the communication in your news feed.

5. B. The content

Click on the + to select the type of content you wish to add to the communication

  • Add title
  • Add text
  • Add quote
  • Add image) - JPG or PNG
  • Add video - from an MP4 file
  • Add audio - from an MP3 file
  • Add document - from a PDF file
  • Add link
  • Add training

6. Home banner section

To display your communication on the Wall Slider / Home banner, simply check the corresponding box Display this communication on the home banner.

Once the box is checked, integrate a 750 x 545 pixel image by drag and drop or by clicking on the designated area to browse your computer. Use the Mission Center's built-in zoom-in/zoom-out feature to easily manage the size and rendering of your image.

7. Options section

To finish, select the options for your communication:

  • Allow learners to share this communication(Allow sharing)

The sharing feature allows your learners to share the communication on their own social networks.

An example of sharing a communication on Slack.

  • Allow learners to like this communication (Allow likes)

Enabling the "like" allows your learners to express their interest in a particular communication by clicking on the "heart" icon associated with that communication.

  • Allow learners to comment this communication (Allow comments)

Get your learners to react to a communication by enabling comments. All learners who see the communication will be able to comment on it and react to other learners' comments.

More about comments on Wall communications

  • Use push to notify your learners(Notify yours learners via push notification)

Want your learners to be automatically notified of your communication? Send them a push notification! By default, the title of the communication is added as the text of the push notification. If you prefer, you can edit it to choose your own text of up to 200 characters.

Make this text as engaging as possible! When learners click on the notification, they will be automatically directed to your communication.

Note: Customization of communications does not apply to push notifications.

Save or send?

Need to translate your article? Start by saving it as a draft. You can then handle its translation directly online.

Once everything is ready, just click on Send to get your article straight to your learners!

How to send a Video-type communication?

Video type communication allows you to create and structure a communication highlighting a video. Communication can be used for content on YouTube, DailyMotion, etc. but also for your videos.

How to create an video-type communication item from the Mission Center ?

1. Choose "Video" as the communication type

> COMMUNITY/ Communications>Create communication

Click onVideo.Video is thesecond communication-type available

2. Choose your target

Select your recipients by choosing one of the 3 available options:

-Send to all learners(checked by default)
-Refine with filters(to send your communication to a group of learners from your custom fields)
-Refine with emails/logins(to send to a list of learners)

3. Choose your language of publication (edition)

You can now set a default language for your communications and manage translations directly in the Languages section.

Read the article on management of languages in articles.

4. Header section

The title of a communication can contain up to 90 characters. Make it as engaging as possible. Why not personalize it with the first name of your learners for example?

Note: Adding a title is mandatory - you cannot publish or save your communication if it is not completed.

5. Content section

Add the video:

  • You can paste the link to a video hosted on the web (YouTube, Facebook, Dailymotion, Vimeo) in thePaste a video URL field
  • OR you can simply Choose a file saved on your computer in the Upload a video file field. If you choose this second option, the file must be in MP4, with 720p resolution and a maximum weight of 50MB.

This communication type is ideal for mobile, but the video cannotbe seen in offline mode.

If you think your video is too heavy and takes too long to load in the Mission Center, in this article you will find out how to reduce its size.

  1. You can Add a custom thumbnail image to the video. If you do not add one, the default thumbnail will be displayed.
  2. You can insert a short description (limited to 140 characters) in the A description that will be displayed on the Wall field.

6. Home Banner section

To display your communication on the Wall Slider / Home banner, simply check the corresponding box Display this communication on the home banner.

Once the box is checked, integrate a 750 x 545 pixel image by drag and drop or by clicking on the designated area to browse your computer. Use the Mission Center's built-in zoom-in/zoom-out feature to easily manage the size and rendering of your image.

7. Options section

To finish, select the options for your communication:

  • Allow learners to share this communication(Allow sharing)

The sharing feature allows your learners to share the communication on their own social networks.

An example of Video communication.

  • Allow learners to like this communication (Allow likes)

Enabling the "like" allows your learners to express their interest in a particular communication by clicking on the "heart" icon associated with that communication.

  • Allow learners to comment this communication (Allow comments)

Get your learners to react to a communication by enabling comments. All learners who see the communication will be able to comment on it and react to other learners' comments.

More about comments on Wall communications

  • Use push to notify your learners(Notify yours learners via push notification)

Want your learners to be automatically notified of your communication? Send them a push notification! By default, the title of the communication is added as the text of the push notification. If you prefer, you can edit it to choose your own text of up to 200 characters.

Make this text as engaging as possible! When learners click on the notification, they will be automatically directed to your communication.

Note: Customization of communications does not apply to push notifications.

Save or send?

Need to translate your article? Start by saving it as a draft. You can then handle its translation directly online.

Once everything is ready, just click on Send to get your article straight to your learners!

How to send a Web Link-type Communication?

Web link communication allows you to create and structure a communication highlighting a page on the Internet. Communication can be used for any site, however mobile devices on Android require a secure URL (https instead of http).

HOW TO CREATE AN Weblink-TYPE COMMUNICATION ITEM FROM THE MISSION CENTER ?

1. CHOOSE "VIDEO" AS THE COMMUNICATION TYPE

> COMMUNITY/ Communications>Create communication

Web linkis the third communication-type available.

2. CHOOSE YOUR TARGET

Select your recipients by choosing one of the 3 available options:

-Send to all learners(checked by default)
-Refine with filters(to send your communication to a group of learners from your custom fields)
-Refine with emails/logins(to send to a list of learners)

3. CHOOSE YOUR LANGUAGE OF PUBLICATION (EDITION)

You can now set a default language for your communications and manage translations directly in theLanguagessection.

Read thearticle on management of languages in articles.

4. HEADER SECTION

The title of a communication can contain up to 90 characters. Make it as engaging as possible. Why notpersonalizeit with the first name of your learners for example?

Note: Adding a title is mandatory - you cannot publish or save your communication if it is not completed.

5. Content section

Type the website URL address that you wish your learners to visit.

6. SECTION«BANDEAU DE COMMUNICATION»(«HOME BANNER»)

To display your communication on the Wall Slider / Home banner, simply check the corresponding boxDisplay this communication on the home banner.

Once the box is checked, integrate a 750 x 545 pixel image by drag and drop or by clicking on the designated area to browse your computer.Use the Mission Center's built-in zoom-in/zoom-out featureto easily manage the size and rendering of your image.

7. OPTIONS SECTION

To finish, select the options for your communication:

  • Allow learners to share this communication(Allow sharing)

Thesharingfeature allows your learners to share the communication on their own social networks.

An example of Web link communication.

  • Allow learners to like this communication (Allow likes)

Enabling the "like" allows your learners to express their interest in a particular communication by clicking on the "heart" icon associated with that communication.

  • Allow learners to comment this communication (Allow comments)

Get your learners to react to a communication by enabling comments. All learners who see the communication will be able to comment on it and react to other learners' comments.

More about comments on Wall communications

  • Use push to notify your learners(Notify yours learners via push notification)

Want your learners to be automatically notified of your communication? Send them a push notification! By default, the title of the communication is added as the text of the push notification. If you prefer, you can edit it to choose your own text of up to 200 characters.

Make this text as engaging as possible! When learners click on the notification, they will be automatically directed to your communication.

Note: Customization of communications does not apply to push notifications.

How to send an Image-type communication?

The image-type communication allows you to create and structure a communication highlighting an image.

HOW TO CREATE AN image-TYPE COMMUNICATION ITEM FROM THE MISSION CENTER ?

1. CHOOSE "image" AS THE COMMUNICATION TYPE

> COMMUNITY/ Communications>Create communication

Click onImage. Imageis the fourth communication-type available.

2. CHOOSE YOUR TARGET

Select your recipients by choosing one of the 3 available options:

-Send to all learners(checked by default)
-Refine with filters(to send your communication to a group of learners from your custom fields)
-Refine with emails/logins(to send to a list of learners)

3. CHOOSE YOUR LANGUAGE OF PUBLICATION (EDITION)

You can now set a default language for your communications and manage translations directly in theLanguagessection.

Read thearticle on management of languages in articles.

4. HEADER SECTION

The title of a communication can contain up to 90 characters. Make it as engaging as possible. Why notpersonalizeit with the first name of your learners for example?

Note: Adding a title is mandatory - you cannot publish or save your communication if it is not completed. The picture size is 350 x 250.

5. HOME BANNER SECTION

To display your communication on the Wall Slider / Home banner, simply check the corresponding boxDisplay this communication on the home banner.

Once the box is checked, integrate a 750 x 545 pixel image by drag and drop or by clicking on the designated area to browse your computer.Use the Mission Center's built-in zoom-in/zoom-out featureto easily manage the size and rendering of your image.

6. OPTIONS SECTION

To finish, select the options for your communication:

  • Allow learners to share this communication(Allow sharing)

Thesharingfeature allows your learners to share the communication on their own social networks.

An example of Image communication.

  • Allow learners to like this communication (Allow likes)

Enabling the "like" allows your learners to express their interest in a particular communication by clicking on the "heart" icon associated with that communication.

  • Allow learners to comment this communication (Allow comments)

Get your learners to react to a communication by enabling comments. All learners who see the communication will be able to comment on it and react to other learners' comments.

More about comments on Wall communications

  • Use push to notify your learners(Notify yours learners via push notification)

Want your learners to be automatically notified of your communication? Send them a push notification! By default, the title of the communication is added as the text of the push notification. If you prefer, you can edit it to choose your own text of up to 200 characters.

Make this text as engaging as possible! When learners click on the notification, they will be automatically directed to your communication.

Note: Customization of communications does not apply to push notifications.

SAVE OR SEND?

Need to translate your article? Start by saving it as a draft. You can then handle its translation directly online.

Once everything is ready, just click onSendto get your article straight to your learners!

How to send a Training Course-type communication?

Training-type communication allows you to create and structure a communication highlighting one of the training courses in your catalog. Communication can be used to publicize or follow a training course in which you have enrolled your learners beforehand, or even to allow your learners to enroll with a simple click.

HOW TO CREATE AN training course-TYPE COMMUNICATION ITEM FROM THE MISSION CENTER ?

1. CHOOSE "Training course" AS THE COMMUNICATION TYPE

> COMMUNITY/ Communications>Create communication

TheTraining course is the fifth communication-type available.

2. CHOOSE YOUR TARGET

Select your recipients by choosing one of the 3 available options:

-Send to all learners(checked by default)
-Refine with filters(to send your communication to a group of learners from your custom fields)
-Refine with emails/logins(to send to a list of learners)

3. CHOOSE YOUR LANGUAGE OF PUBLICATION (EDITION)

You can now set a default language for your communications and manage translations directly in theLanguagessection.

Read thearticle on management of languages in articles.

4. HEADER SECTION

The title of a communication can contain up to 90 characters. Make it as engaging as possible. Why notpersonalizeit with the first name of your learners for example?

Note: Adding a title is mandatory - you cannot publish or save your communication if it is not completed.

5. Content section

Start writing the name of the training course (or its code) and a list of training course will be offered. Select the training course you want to highlight

6. HOME BANNER SECTION

To display your communication on the Wall Slider / Home banner, simply check the corresponding boxDisplay this communication on the home banner.

Once the box is checked, integrate a 750 x 545 pixel image by drag and drop or by clicking on the designated area to browse your computer.Use the Mission Center's built-in zoom-in/zoom-out featureto easily manage the size and rendering of your image.

7. OPTIONS SECTION

To finish, select the options for your communication:

  • Allow learners to share this communication(Allow sharing)

Thesharingfeature allows your learners to share the communication on their own social networks.

An example of Training course communication.

  • Allow learners to like this communication (Allow likes)

Enabling the "like" allows your learners to express their interest in a particular communication by clicking on the "heart" icon associated with that communication.

  • Allow learners to comment this communication (Allow comments)

Get your learners to react to a communication by enabling comments. All learners who see the communication will be able to comment on it and react to other learners' comments.

More about comments on Wall communications

  • Use push to notify your learners(Notify yours learners via push notification)

Want your learners to be automatically notified of your communication? Send them a push notification! By default, the title of the communication is added as the text of the push notification. If you prefer, you can edit it to choose your own text of up to 200 characters.

Make this text as engaging as possible! When learners click on the notification, they will be automatically directed to your communication.

Note: Customization of communications does not apply to push notifications.

SAVE OR SEND?

Need to translate your article? Start by saving it as a draft. You can then handle its translation directly online.

Once everything is ready, just click onSendto get your article straight to your learners!

How commenting works with communications on the Wall?

News Callisto - October 2019 (subject to republication of your application)

Thanks to the commenting functionality, you will be able togenerate more emulation around the communications you post on the Wall of your app! Using theComments feature, your learners can react to and interact around the articles, videos, training courses andother communications you post. With your Manager account on the Mission Center, you can keep
track of your most commented articles and moderate any comments you deem inappropriate.

Note:in the comments statistics visible in the App or in the MC, the data included are those of root comments only (sub-comments are not taken into account)

How to enable the "Comments" feature on the Mission Center?

When youcreate a communication on the Mission Center, the "Comments" feature appears in the list of available options.

Simply checkAllow comments and the feature will be enabled for the communication in question. Once posted, all the learners who receive the communication will be able to comment on it from the Wall of their app.

Comments can be added to all types of communication.

How learners comment on Communications straight from the app?

From the Wall, when learners see a bubble icon, that means that they can comment on the communication content.

They simply click on the bubble to access the comments section for the communication in question.

For any Article-type communication, the "+" icon at the bottom right of the mobile app screen shows all the available actions, including the bubble icon for adding a comment.

The number displayed next to the bubble icon tells the learner how many comments have already been posted for any given communication.

A learner can 'like' another learner's comment by tapping on the heart icon below the comment, or respond to it by tapping on the bubble icon.

What can learners share via the Wall comments feature?

Learners can exchange text, emojis, images and web links. They can also mention a learner having also access to the communication. To know more, read the article "What can learners share via the Wall comments feature?".

How is a learner notified that another learner has replied to his/her comment?

The learner is alerted by a push notification each time they get an answer or a reaction to a comment they have posted. When they click on the notification, they are taken directly to the Wall page, and will find the notification center just below the Wall Slider.

Here they can view all the new replies and reactions to the comments they have posted. Unread notifications stand out by their colored background. The learner can choose to mark all notifications as read by clicking on the icon at the top right of the screen.

How a manager is notified of new comments on the Wall?

Notifications are not automatic for the Manager. Managers can use their learner account to consult new comments directly on the app.

Equally, in the Mission Center, they can track the number of comments associated with any given communication.

This data can also be located and exported from the Reports tab in the Communications section.

Articles that may be of interest to you:

- How moderation works for comments on the Wall?

How does moderation work for comments on the Wall?

Comments published on the Wall are moderated in two stages:

  1. The comment may be reported by a learner in the app
  2. The manager then accepts or rejects the comment via the Mission Center

FROM THE APP TO THE MISSION CENTER

Learners can report a Wall comment that they consider offensive or inappropriate. To do so, they simply press and stay pressed on the comment in question and selectReport.

Reported comments are forwarded to the Mission Center in the Communications > Comments moderation section.

> COMMUNITY/ Communications> Comments moderation

For each reported comment, the manager can open the communication (in the web application) and view the associated comments. The manager then chooses whether to accept or reject the reported comment.

You can filter the reported comments according to their status:

  • Not yet moderated(comments newly reported)
  • Moderated(log of moderated comments)
  • All reported comments

The comment has been accepted? It remains visible on the Wall.

The comment has been rejected? It disappears from the Wall. Instead, a comment This comment has been moderated appears.

PERMISSIONS TO REPORT AND MODERATE

Within the application, all learners who can comment on a communication are also entitled to report a comment on the same communication.

In order to be able to moderate comments via the Mission Center, one out of two conditions must be fulfilled:

  • either you have a "Super admin" account: the super administrator has the necessary rights to moderate any comment reported
  • or you have a manager account with the role "Can moderate comments": the manager then has the necessary rights to moderate comments on communications they have published themselves.

HOW A MANAGER IS NOTIFIED OF NEW COMMENTS ON
THE WALL?

There are no automatic notifications on the application or on the Mission Center of new comments to moderate. We advise you to consult your moderation page once a day - depending also on the number of communications with the activated Comments option that you send.

Articles that may be of interest to you:

-How commenting works with communications on the Wall?

What can learners share via the Wall comments feature? 

Comments can be activated whena communication is sent to the Wall.

Learners can then share text, but also emojis, images and web links. They can also mention learners who also have access to communication.

To comment, the learner must click on the “text bubble” icon at the bottom right of the communication. Within an article, (s)he clicks on the "+" button to then select the text bubble.

1. Text and emojis sharing

The learner can simply comment on the communication with text and emojis (those from the mobile device operating system).

2. Image sharing

The learner can comment on the communication and add a picture to it.

To do this, (s)he clicks on the camera and has two options:

  • he can take a photo with the smartphone camera - the image can then be sent directly for comment but will not be saved on the phone.
  • he selects the image he wishes to insert from the image gallery.

When the image is confirmed, a window allows it to crop, resize or even zoom in on part of the image. After validation, the image is added to the body of the text of the comment that the learner wishes to make. (S)He just has to click on the send arrow.

Note: if the comment mixes text and image, the image will be automatically placed under the text box.

3. Web link sharing

The learner can comment on the communication and add a Web link to it.

(S)He just needs to insert the link address and a thumbnail of the related site will appear.

A la rédaction :

Rendu du commentaire avec lien Web :

Note: if the comment includes an image and a web link, the site thumbnail will be replaced by the image chosen. The link remains accessible with one click.

4. Mention of a learner who also has access to the communication

The learner can comment on the communication and mention another learner who also has access to the communication.

(S)He just has to insert “@” and add the first 3 letters of the learner's name. A list will be proposed and (s)he can select the learner.

The learner's search can be done by last name, first name, email or login. Once the learner is selected, it is the first name and last name that appear in the mention.

Learners ranking following their social activity

Learners ranking on communications

> COMMUNITY/ Communications>Ranking

You can use filters for your ranking and define a period for your search using the calendar.

You access the ranking of learners of your community who have used likes or shares the most (depending on the option selected, See image below).

What are the statistics of the Wall?

In order to be able to study the social behaviors of your learners and measure their engagement, you have the possibility of monitoring Wall communications statistics.

1. Communications reports

2. Learners ranking on communications

Note : the number of views is applied on articles only (it is available below the communication, as for the likes and shares numbers)

1. Communications reports

> COMMUNITY/ Communications>Reporting

You access the following statistics:

  • Social networks: key indicators (number of likes and shares, nombre de partages et likes, compared with the communications that you send) (graph)
  • The most liked communications (table)
  • The less liked communications (table)
  • The most sharedcommunications (table)
  • The less shared communications (table)

2. Communications ranking

> COMMUNITY/ Communications>Ranking

Access the page in the same way as for reports, but click Ranking to the right of the reports.

HOW TO GET A DETAILED VIEW of the reports or the ranking (custom FIELDs)?

Click onFilters:

and fill in the information in the different custom fields.

Finish by clicking on Apply.

Note:If you made a mistake in one of the custom fields, click on Reset to clear the data and start again from the beginning.

HOW TO OBTAIN REPORTS OR ranking OVER A DEFINED PERIOD?

You can select a period for which you want to obtain the key indicators.

Note: This option will only update the History of the penetration rate and the Behavior of registered learners.

Click on the calendar

You have different options:

  • Last 30 days
  • Last 3 months
  • Last 12 months
  • Custom: use the calendar to define start date and end date

Click onApplyto confirm your selection.

Note: you can also export these reports under Excel® format by clicking on Exporttop right

How to communicate access information to your learners?

There are 2 options:

  1. automatic sending of an email to the learners, from the Mission Center
  2. sending an email from a third-party system

automatic sending of an email to the learners, from the Mission Center

When you create your learners database, you can choose to send an automatic email. This email includes:

  • The URLto download the application
  • The learner connexion ID
  • The link so that the learner can create apassword

For this automatic sending, you just have to check the "Send an email to the learners created in this import" box, while creating accounts. Sending can not be scheduled.

sending an email from a third-party system

You can choose to manage the sending of first connection information to your learners through your third-party system. For this, you will communicate to them:

  • The URLto download the application
  • The login
  • The process to create a password: on the first login, learners will have to click on "Forgotten password?", then enter their email address used while registering them in the Mission Center. An email will be sent to them, containing a link to create their password.

How can I customize a communication with the learner's information?

You can now customize by adding the learner's information:

  • your communications
  • a text in an activity (with the Web authoring tool)
  • a weblink type activity
  • a weblink type communication

1. Customize your communications

Access your Mission Center and click onCommunications,then create your communication.

In a to be filled field, simply type$(and the different elements of customization will be proposed to you, you can click to select the one you wish to use.

2. Customize a web link type activity

See point 1 above.

What are the manager's rights?

When the manager account is created in the Mission Center, there is no automatically assigned role. It is necessary to update this section in order to give the manager an access to the back office functionality(ies) :

  • Categories and training courses
    • Can manage the catalog (both training courses and categories): the manager accesses the menu of categories and can then create / modify / manage a category but also move a training course from one category to an other
    • Can create training courses: the manager can create / modify / manage a training course (but not its content)
      • can generate licenses
      • can import licenses
    • Can create content: the manager access the authoring page of the training course and can then create / modify / manage modules and activities
    • Can publish training courses: the manager can publish a training course when the Test version has beenvalidated, but can not create / modify / manage modules and activities
    • Can create and manage Live sessions: by default, a manager having this role can see the Live! sessions created by him/her and by super admin accounts
      • (1)Can see the Live! sessions in the perimeter: with this role, it is possible to ALSO see the Live! sessions created by other managers from the same perimeter as ours - defined in the custom fields
  • Learners and communications
    • Can access the learners section: a a manager can access the learners of his/her defined filter or those enrolled in training courses to which he/she has access
      • Can send communications
      • Can moderate comments
    • Can delete learners massively: a manager can delete learnersof his/her defined filter
  • Statistics
    • Can view reports: a manager can see the learners statistics of his/her defined filter or those enrolled in training courses to which he/she has access
  • Administration
    • Can create managers (administrators)
    • Can manage publishers (On the shelf contents)
  • Filters: it defines which group of learners the manager can manage (view, create, deactivate) based on the values of the filters he/she can access.
  • Access to training courses: it defines which applications and training courses the manager is allowed to manage.

Rôle (cf. import file) Description

roleAnalyst

Can see reports

roleAuthor

Can create content

rolePerimeterTrainer

Can also see the Live! sessions created by other managers from the same perimeter (1)

roleLearnerManager

Can access the learners section

roleTrainingManager

Can create training courses

roleTrainer

Can create and manage Live!sessions

roleCatalogManager

Can manage the catalog (both training courses and categories)

roleCommunicationManager

Can send communications*

roleThemeManager

Can create themes

roleAdminManager

Can create managers

roleTrainingPublisher

Can manage editors (OTS)
roleContentLicenseProvider

Can generate content licenses (OTS)
roleContentLicenseImporter

Can import content licenses (OTS)

* For this right, the Mission Manager must also have the Learner Manager role

How to create a manager account in the Mission Center?

A Manager account is needed to access the Mission Center.

1. Creation directly in the Mission Center

> ADMINISTRATION/ Managers>Create

Fill in the fields (name, email, password, confirm) and finish by clicking onCreate.

Note:Password can only be modified by the Manager.

Once the manager account is created, he doesn't have any rights (on the right, a triangle will indicate that no right is granted) :

You have to edit it to grant rights.

> ADMINISTRATION/ Managers> your manager's account

In theRolessection, click onEdit:

2. Importing manager(s)

> ADMINISTRATION/ Managers> Import

If needed, you can download the empty import file clicking on

Here is an example of empty file:

Once the file completed and saved under CSV format (UTF-8), you can upload it in the Mission Center by dragging / dropping the file (or clicking on the button).

This action will update the already existing manager's accounts (based on identical login) or will create a new account if it does not exist yet.

How to deactivate / delete a manager account?

Note: it is not possible to delete a manager account. Indeed, deleting an account would mean deleting all of the data linked to the account (communications on the Wall, statistics, etc.). However, you can deactivate an account so that access to the Mission Center is blocked.

How to deactivate a manager account?

> ADMINISTRATION/ Managers> your manager

To the right of the manager picture, click on

In the popup window, select Inactiveand click on Saveto save your modifications.

How to deactivate / delete a super admin account?

A super admin account cannot be changed, deactivated or deleted directly in the Mission Center.

If you wish to make a change to a super admin account, please contact your Teach on Mars Project Manager.

How to import managers?

Do you have several managers to create and want to avoid doing it manually, one by one? Then this article is for you!

> ADMINISTRATION/ Managers> Import

Where to download the file?

Click on You can download a sample CSV file here

Your file resumes:

  • email, manager's email
  • username, login to connect
  • password, password
  • statusActive, set the account status: Y for Yes / N for No
  • roleAnalyst, give access to statistics reports: Y for Yes / N for No
  • roleAuthor, allows to create content: Y for Yes / N for No
  • roleLearnerManager, give access to learners: Y for Yes / N for No
  • roleTrainingManager, allows to create training courses: Y for Yes / N for No
  • roleTrainer, role allowing to create and manage Live! sessions: Y for Yes / N for No
  • roleCatalogManager, allows to manage the catalog (training courses and categories) : Y for Yes / N for No
  • roleCommunicationManager, authorizes to send communications: Y for Yes / N for No
  • roleAdminManager, gives the right to create managers: Y for Yes / N for No
  • roleTrainingPublisher, allows to manage editors (to create editors profile if the feature "Editors" is enabled)
  • roleContentLicenseProvider, allows you to generate content licenses (to share training courses to another Mission Center if the "Off-the-shelf content" feature is enabled)
  • roleContentLicenseImporter, allows you to import content licenses (to receive training courses shared from another Mission Center if the "Off-the-shelf content" feature is enabled)

How to save the file?

If you use your own Excel® file, check to save it correctly in CSV UTF-8 format:

  • Open your Excel® file containing your learners list
  • Go to the "File" tab
  • Click on "Save as" and select the file type "CSV (separator: semicolon)", then click on "Save"
  • To encode your CSV file in UTF-8, open it in a text editor: Notepad on Windows (Start Menu> All Programs> Accessories> Notepad) or TextWrangler on Mac.
  • Click on the "File" menu, then "Save as" and in the drop-down list "Encode", select "UTF-8". It is absolutely necessary to choose the semicolon as separator, commas, even in UTF-8, is not working.
  • After saving it, your file is encoded in UTF-8: you can upload it to the Mission Center.

How to switch a manager account to super admin?

There cannot be duplicate email addresses for an administrator account or a super admin account. As the email address serves as the login, a single address cannot be both manager and super admin. If an administrator must become a super admin:

  1. the request must be made to the Teach on Mars Project Manager
  2. the deletion of the manager account will change the avatar on the communications created by the manager: the main avatar will appear on the app


The decision to create or not a manager or super admin account must be considered from the start to avoid possible consequences, but also the super admin account allowing many additional actions, should not be asked for managers too few trained.

How and why give a Manager access to a selection of training courses?

You can give a specific manager (or more) access to a selection of your catalog training courses in order to avoid him/her to see all categories.

> ADMINISTRATION/ Managers>your manager

Once in the manager profile, click onEditin theAccess to Training coursessection

TheAccess to all training coursesoption is still available, as well asAccess to no training course. And the l'optionAllow this manager to see all learners who have access to these training courses (even out of the specified filters)is still available.

For the training courses selection, click theSelect training coursestab.

You can now select:

  • a category (and therefore all the training courses it contains)
  • a subcategory (and therefore all the training courses it contains)
  • one or more training courses of a category

Finish by clickingSave.

Live! mode presentation

Enliven your classroom trainings with a real-time mobile activity by choosing the Live! mode.

Learners connect to the Live! session from the application and complete the Live! activities, while the trainer has access to the results in real time.

Activities in Live! mode are protected by an access code generated from the Mission Center. This code allows learners to access activities as soon as the trainer or facilitator starts the Live! session.

Note: a Live! session can gather up to 100 connected users. Internet connection is required.

WHICH ACTIVITIES CAN BE USED LIVE?

The Live! mode can be used in two ways :

  • Competing with other learners in scored activities:
    • Challenge
    • Fill the Gap
    • Pick a Word
    • Sushi Game
    • Training Game
    • Wordspool
    • Quiz Game: with this activity, learners of a common Live! session can challenge each other: nothing as such to drive their motivation up!
  • Feedback with theBrainstormingactivity

The Live! is accessible via the red button, just below the progress bar.
The Live! session may include one or more training activities.

Nextsteps :

How can I turn my activity into a Live! activity?

How do I create a Live! session?

How to start a Live! session?

How do learners connect to the Live! session?

How to run a Live! session?

How can I turn my activity into a Live! activity?

(Previous step:Live! mode presentation)

> CATALOG/ Training courses> Your training course > Authoring

IF THE WEB AUTHORING IS ACTIVE ON YOUR MISSION CENTER:

When editing the activity, go to the Paramaters tab and check"This activity is accessible in a Live! session".

IF THE WEB AUTHORING IS NOT ACTIVE ON YOUR MISSION CENTER:

In theActivity editionpop-up window, check theThis is a Live! activitybox.

Notes: A Live! activity is only accessible with a Live! Session code.

Once the Live! activated, the training must be published in order to appear in the application (the Live! mode is not available in Test version).

The Brainstorming activity can only be published as a Live! activity. Therefore, the Live! mode is enabled by default.

Next steps:

How do I create a Live! session?

How to start a Live! session?

How do learners connect to the Live! session?

How to run a Live! session?

How do I create a Live! session?

(Previous step: How to turn my activity into a Live! activity? )

> CATALOG/ Training courses> Your training course > Live! sessions

Note: Live session management! is only possible when at least one Live! activity is available in the training course.Your Manager account must have the role "Can create and manage Live sessions!" to do the following operations.

  • Click on "Create"
  • Choose a name and set the date of your session
  • Validate by clicking on "Create"
  • Your session is now created! It appears in the list of Live! sessions.

Next steps:

How to start a Live! session?

How do learners connect to the Live! session?

How to run a Live! session?

How to start a Live! session?

(Previous step:How to create a Live! Session?)

> CATALOG/ Training courses> Your training course > Your Live! session
  • Select your Live! session


  • You reach the administration interface of the Live session! where the access code is displayed.
  • Share this code to your learners.
  • The learners who connect appear progressively on the screen.

Next steps:

How do learners connect to the Live! session?

How to run a Live! session?

How do learners connect to the Live! session?

(Previous step:How to start a Live! session?)

There are two ways for the learners to connect to the Live! Session:

1. Click on the red button "Enroll in the Live! session" just below the progress bar, then add the Live! session code.

2. Click on the Live! activity in the training course, then add the Live! session code.
